analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal pa'i dkyil 'khor chen por @10a * //
translated: they are explained in the great maṇḍala of Trilokavijaya.

original: bshad pa'i yi ge h'um ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi chos kyi phyag rgya'o //🔽yi ge tr'am ni rin chen h'um mdzad kyi chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i yi ge h'um ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi chos kyi phyag rgya'o // yi ge tr'am ni rin chen h'um mdzad kyi chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The syllable hūṃ is the dharma-mudra of Vajra-hūṃkāra.🔽The syllable tram is the dharma-mudra of Ratna-hūṃkāra.

original: yi ge hr'i: ni chos kyi h'um mdzad kyi'o //
analyzed: yi ge hr'i: ni chos kyi h'um mdzad kyi'o //
translated: The syllable hrīḥ is the dharma-mudra of Dharma-hūṃkāra.

original: yi ge aa ni las kyi h'um mdzad kyi'o //
analyzed: yi ge aa ni las kyi h'um mdzad kyi'o //
translated: The syllable a is the dharma-mudra of Karma-hūṃkāra.

original: h'um he tram tam hi hri /
analyzed: h'um he tram tam hi hri /
translated: Hūṃ he traṃ taṃ hi hriḥ

original: de ha dhe ga ti /
analyzed: de ha dhe ga ti /
translated: de he gati

original: h'um gram ke bam tre a'a /
analyzed: h'um gram ke bam tre a'a /

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nas rdo rje khu tshur gyi bar gyi'o //

original: ma h'a ra ti h'um /
analyzed: ma h'a ra ti h'um /

original: r'u pa sho bhe h'um /
analyzed: r'u pa sho bhe h'um /
translated: rūpa śobhe hūṃ

original: sho tra soo khya h'um /
analyzed: sho tra soo khya h'um /
translated: śrotra saukhye hūṃ

original: sarbba p'u tse h'um /
analyzed: sarbba p'u tse h'um /
translated: sarvapūjye hūṃ

original: pra hl'a da ni pha la ga mi h'um /🔽su te dzam gra h'um /
analyzed: pra hl'a da ni pha la ga mi h'um / su te dzam gra h'um /
translated: prahlādaniphalagāmini hūṃ🔽sutejaṃgra hūṃ

original: soo gandha gi h'um /
analyzed: soo gandha gi h'um /
translated: sa gandhagi hūṃ

original: zhes bya ba sgeg mo la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sgeg mo la sogs pa nas /
translated: This is the Dharma-seal of the Goddess of Charm, etc.

original: khro bo rdo rje dri chab ma'i bar gyi chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: khro bo rdo rje dri chab ma'i bar gyi chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: up to the Vajra-Perfume Goddess of Wrath.

original: phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs rnams kyi ni rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs rnams kyi ni rang rig pa'o //
translated: The outer Vajra Family has the self-consecration.

original: sngar bshad pa'i gar byed pa'i phyag rgya ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha thams cad kyi las kyi phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i gar byed pa'i phyag rgya ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha thams cad kyi las kyi phyag rgya yin no //
translated: The seal of dance explained above is the Action Seal of all mundane and supramundane deities.

original: rdo rje mdzad la sogs pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje mdzad la sogs pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po yin no //
translated: The Great Seal is the Great Seal explained in the Great Mandala of the Three World Vanquisher, such as the Vajra Performance, etc.🔽The secret worship, such as the Vajra Charm, etc.

original: rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams dang / rdo rje rig pa dam pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams dang / rdo rje rig pa dam pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: and the dance with the Great Seal, such as the Vajra Knowledge, etc.

original: rdo rje chu srin la mthar thug gi bar du ma bha ma dang bcas pas gar byed pa /
analyzed: rdo rje chu srin la mthar thug gi bar du ma bha ma dang bcas pas gar byed pa /
translated: up to the Vajra Sea Monster, is the Action Seal.

original: sbyor ba can ni 'dir phyag rgya chen po yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba can ni 'dir phyag rgya chen po yin no //
translated: The Great Seal here is the union.

original: 'di'i mdog dang phyag rgya dang mtshan ma rnams kyi nges pa ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por bstan zin pas de nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mdog dang phyag rgya dang mtshan ma rnams kyi nges pa ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por bstan zin pas de nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The colors, emblems, and signs of these are the same as those taught in the great maṇḍala of Trilokavijaya, so they should be understood from there.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa'i cho ga lhag ma rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa'i cho ga lhag ma rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining rites taught in the great maṇḍala of Trilokavijaya should also be adopted.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the maṇḍala rite of the Trilokacakra Karmamaṇḍala is complete.

original: // / de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: // / de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa ste /
translated: Then, the word “then” means immediately after.

original: phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i ris thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu gzhag pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i ris thams cad phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu gzhag pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: It is immediately after all the outer vajra clans are established in the stage of nonretrogression.

original: phyag na rdo rje ni rdo rje h'um mdzad do //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje ni rdo rje h'um mdzad do //
translated: Vajrapāṇi is Vajra Hūṃkāra.

original: rdo rje'i rigs de dag thams cad ni phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi don la yang dag par sbyor pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs de dag thams cad ni phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi don la yang dag par sbyor pa'o //
translated: All those vajra clans are truly applied to the benefit of all sentient beings of all the outer vajra clans.

original: sems can kyang yin la de thams cad kyang yin pas na sems can de dag thams cad kyi don to //
analyzed: sems can kyang yin la de thams cad kyang yin pas na sems can de dag thams cad kyi don to //
translated: And since they are all sentient beings, it is the aim of all those sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyis @10b ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub de bsgom pa ni sems can gyi don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyis @10b ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub de bsgom pa ni sems can gyi don to //
translated: The aim of sentient beings is the accomplishment of all mundane and supramundane aims, in accordance with their wishes.

original: khyod kyis de ltar yang dag par nges par sbyor zhing yongs su mi gtong pas /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar yang dag par nges par sbyor zhing yongs su mi gtong pas /
translated: You should apply yourself to that in the correct manner and not abandon it.

original: dus 'di nas nye par bzung ste snying po byang chub la mthar thug gi bar du sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dus 'di nas nye par bzung ste snying po byang chub la mthar thug gi bar du sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: From this time forward, you should work for the aim of sentient beings until the end of cyclic existence.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu gzhag ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You should establish them in the stage of nonregression.

original: phyir mi ldog pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i lam la gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i lam la gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir //
translated: Those who are nonregressing are established in the path to the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba'i lam la mi 'jug cing mi ldog pa des ni phyir mi ldog pa'i tha snyad du byed de phyir mi ldog par med cing mi ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam la mi 'jug cing mi ldog pa des ni phyir mi ldog pa'i tha snyad du byed de phyir mi ldog par med cing mi ldog pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Because he does not enter and does not turn back from the path of cyclic existence, he is called “irreversible.” Not turning back is not turning back.

original: sa de la mngon par 'dus byas pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa de la mngon par 'dus byas pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By accomplishing that, he realizes the eighth bodhisattva stage.

original: des na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu gzhag pa /🔽sems can lhag ma rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la /
analyzed: des na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu gzhag pa / sems can lhag ma rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba la /
translated: Therefore, he is established on the irreversible stage.🔽For the sake of the remaining sentient beings,🔽Vajrapāṇi, the Blessed One, is the secret of all the Tathāgatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He is the one who has entered all the Tathāgatas.

original: mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “With knowledge” means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba ma mkhyen du zin kyang sgyu ma rdo rje la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis lung bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba nyon cig ces bya ba de gang lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba ma mkhyen du zin kyang sgyu ma rdo rje la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis lung bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba nyon cig ces bya ba de gang lags /
translated: Even though he does not know the secret of all the Tathagatas, the Blessed One Vairocana, by means of the prediction of Maya Vajra and so forth, says to him, Listen to the secret of all the Tathagatas!

original: nyan pa ni rang nyid nyams su len pa dang / gzhan la gdams ngag ston pas na /
analyzed: nyan pa ni rang nyid nyams su len pa dang / gzhan la gdams ngag ston pas na /
translated: Listening is the cause of one's own practice and the teaching of instructions to others.

original: bdag gsang ba thams cad 'dzin par dbang bskur na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gsang ba 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis dbang bskur pa yin pas rgyu de'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag gsang ba thams cad 'dzin par dbang bskur na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gsang ba 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis dbang bskur pa yin pas rgyu de'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, he says, If I am consecrated as the holder of all secrets, that is, if I am consecrated by the reason of holding the secret, then for that reason,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba de gang lags //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba de gang lags //
translated: what is the secret of all the Tathagatas?

original: bka' stsol cig ces pa ste /
analyzed: bka' stsol cig ces pa ste /
translated: Please tell me!

original: kun nas bdag gis rtogs par byed pas na dka'o //🔽de nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun nas bdag gis rtogs par byed pas na dka'o // de nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is difficult to understand because it is completely understood by oneself.🔽Then, means

original: de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'o //
translated: immediately after.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba de'i rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang pa'i rdo rje ste /🔽ma chags pa dang ma sdang pa dang ma rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa bstan nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba de'i rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang pa'i rdo rje ste / ma chags pa dang ma sdang pa dang ma rmongs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa bstan nas //
translated: The vajra of that secret of all tathagatas is the vajra of the secret of all tathagatas.

original: sems can gyi don mdzad pas na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad pas na gsang ba'o //
translated: It is secret because it is the means of accomplishing the aims of sentient beings by demonstrating the conduct of desire and so forth without attachment, without hatred, and without delusion.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs shing mngon sum du mdzad @11a * //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs shing mngon sum du mdzad @11a * //
translated: The samadhi that focuses on that is the samadhi called the vajra of the secret of all tathagatas.

original: pa'o ; /'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; /'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: He entered and actualized it. This is what is in the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'di gsungs pa ni bshad pa'o //🔽ji lta ji ltar 'dul 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba 'di gsungs pa ni bshad pa'o // ji lta ji ltar 'dul 'gyur ba //
translated: This statement of the secret of all tathagatas is the explanation.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi gzugs kyis 'dul zhing lung dang rtogs pa la rab tu bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi gzugs kyis 'dul zhing lung dang rtogs pa la rab tu bzhag pa'o //
translated: As for in whatever way they are to be disciplined, it is by whatever form that they are to be disciplined and established in the scriptures and realizations.

original: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //🔽zhes bya ba ni /🔽rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ni // zhes bya ba ni / rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of sentient beings🔽is the nature of the Tathāgata.🔽Here, the nature of the Tathāgata is the nature of sentient beings.

original: de la rang gi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la rang gi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the Tathāgata is the nature of sentient beings.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags spang ba dang / zhe sdang spyod pa gang yin pa de dag la khro bas khro ba spang ba dang / gti mug la spyod pa gang yin pa de dag la khyab 'jug sgyu ma'i gzugs bstan pa la sogs pas 'dul bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags spang ba dang / zhe sdang spyod pa gang yin pa de dag la khro bas khro ba spang ba dang / gti mug la spyod pa gang yin pa de dag la khyab 'jug sgyu ma'i gzugs bstan pa la sogs pas 'dul bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Those who are passionate are disciplined by the Tathāgata in the form of a passionate person, through the abandonment of passion by passion. Those who are hateful are disciplined by the Tathāgata in the form of an angry person, through the abandonment of anger by anger. Those who are deluded are disciplined by the Tathāgata in the form of Viṣṇu, Viṣṇu’s illusory form, and so on.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: de lta de ltar sems can don //
analyzed: de lta de ltar sems can don //
translated: In this way and that, for the sake of sentient beings,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa bstan pa de dang des /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa bstan pa de dang des /
translated: By teaching the conduct of passion and so on,

original: de lta de ltar sems can gyi don byas pas /
analyzed: de lta de ltar sems can gyi don byas pas /
translated: in this way and that, for the sake of sentient beings,

original: sems can mngon par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can mngon par 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the aims that sentient beings desire are fulfilled.

original: ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: How is it done?

original: 'dod chags la sogs gtsang bas bya //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs gtsang bas bya //
translated: It is done by one who is pure, by one who is free of attachment,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: thugs rje chen po gzhan gyi dbang gis ma chags pa dang / ma sdang ba dang ma rmongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po gzhan gyi dbang gis ma chags pa dang / ma sdang ba dang ma rmongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is free of attachment, free of aversion, and free of delusion, due to the power of his great compassion.

original: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir ni /
translated: For the benefit of all sentient beings,🔽because that action ripens in the form of happiness, and because it is taught by the Buddhas, you should kill in order to purify sentient beings.

original: bde ba'i rnam par smin pa'i las de'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar sems can yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir khyed kyis gsad par bya'o zhes gnang ba mdzad pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dis bsad pa ni brgyal bar byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam par smin pa'i las de'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar sems can yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir khyed kyis gsad par bya'o zhes gnang ba mdzad pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dis bsad pa ni brgyal bar byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: For this reason, killing is permitted.

original: gang la zhe na //
analyzed: gang la zhe na //
translated: For whom?

original: sems can thams cad la'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la'o //
translated: For all sentient beings.

original: srog gcong ba'i kun nas slong ba'i sdig pas gos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srog gcong ba'i kun nas slong ba'i sdig pas gos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One is not defiled by the sin of taking life.

original: thugs rje gzhan gyi dbang gis phan pa dang bde ba la nges par sbyor ba'i gsod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje gzhan gyi dbang gis phan pa dang bde ba la nges par sbyor ba'i gsod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because killing is permitted for one who is compassionate, who is motivated by the desire to benefit and bring happiness to others.

original: sems can thams cad phan phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad phan phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: For the benefit of all sentient beings, as before.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi don ni sangs rgyas don te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi don ni sangs rgyas don te /
translated: The purpose of the Buddhas is the purpose of the Buddhas.

original: pha rol po longs spyod dang rgyags pas dregs pa'i phyug pa de las nyams par byas nas bstan pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i don @11b la sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi don du rab tu sbyor ba de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu la rab tu sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol po longs spyod dang rgyags pas dregs pa'i phyug pa de las nyams par byas nas bstan pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro // de'i don @11b la sbyor bas sangs rgyas kyi don du rab tu sbyor ba de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu la rab tu sbyor ba ni /
translated: Having caused the other person to fall from his wealth and pride in his possessions, he is established in the teaching.

original: sangs rgyas kyi don du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi don du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Because he is engaged in that purpose, he is engaged for the purpose of the Buddhas. Therefore, the engagement in the result of Buddhahood is the engagement for the purpose of the Buddhas.

original: pha rol nor rnams phrogs pa ni //
analyzed: pha rol nor rnams phrogs pa ni //
translated: Stealing the wealth of others

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: is the wealth of kings, etc.

original: ma byin par len pas kun nas bslang ba'i sdig pas rnal 'byor ba de la gos par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ma byin par len pas kun nas bslang ba'i sdig pas rnal 'byor ba de la gos par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: The yogin is not defiled by the sin of taking what is not given, which is the basis of stealing.

original: /'dod chags 'dra ba'i bde ba med //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'dod chags 'dra ba'i bde ba med // ces bya ba ni /
translated: There is no happiness like passion.

original: de la 'dod chags ni chos bdag med pa'i chags pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ni chos bdag med pa'i chags pa ste /
translated: Therein, passion is the passion for the selflessness of phenomena,

original: mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: which is great non-apprehending compassion.

original: de skad du yang /🔽chos bdag med pa'i chags pa yis //
analyzed: de skad du yang / chos bdag med pa'i chags pa yis //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽The wise delight in the attachment

original: mkhas pa rnams ni dga' bar byed //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni dga' bar byed // ces gsungs so //
translated: to the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'dra ba ni mtshungs pa ste bde ba gzhan na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni mtshungs pa ste bde ba gzhan na med pa'o //
translated: Similarity means sameness, that there is no other bliss.🔽That kind of bliss is offered to the victors and the tathagatas.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bde ba de rgyal ba rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de phul bar bsgom pa'i stobs kyis mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bde ba de rgyal ba rnams dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de phul bar bsgom pa'i stobs kyis mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: It is actualized by the power of meditation.

original: sems can gyi phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba dang dngos grub dam pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba dang dngos grub dam pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, for the sake of the benefit, happiness, and supreme attainment of all sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyi chung ma ni gzhan gyi bud med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma ni gzhan gyi bud med do //
translated: The wife of another is the woman of another.

original: gzhan gyi bud med mchog tu gyur pa ni phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig dang chos dang las kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs so //🔽bsten pa ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med mchog tu gyur pa ni phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig dang chos dang las kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs so // bsten pa ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: The supreme woman of another is the form of the great seal, the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, and the action seal.🔽To rely on means to cultivate.

original: bsod nams thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One will obtain merit means one will acquire.

original: de la bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dag byed kyi bsod nams te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma 'khrud par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dag byed kyi bsod nams te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma 'khrud par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of merit is the merit of purification, which has the meaning of washing away the stains of subject and object.

original: de yang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is because of the desire for this samādhi that all phenomena are naturally pure.🔽For the benefit of all sentient beings

original: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: and for the sake of the teachings of the buddhas,

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: as before.

original: las rnams thams cad byas pa yis //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad byas pa yis //
translated: By all the actions

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: sbyor ba dang / yongs su sbyor ba dang / sor rtog pa dang nan tan du byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin rnam pa bzhi'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las thams cad ni las thams cad do //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / yongs su sbyor ba dang / sor rtog pa dang nan tan du byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin rnam pa bzhi'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las thams cad ni las thams cad do //
translated: the perfection of effort, which has the nature of the four types of effort: application, full application, investigation, and practice. All the actions of the perfection of effort are all actions.

original: thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dngos grub byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dngos grub byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of them are the cause for the accomplishment of the power of benefit, happiness, and mental satisfaction for all sentient beings.

original: byams pa'i zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o //🔽shin tu phul du byung bar 'gyur ba nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa'i bsod @12a * //
analyzed: byams pa'i zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o // shin tu phul du byung bar 'gyur ba nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa'i bsod @12a * //
translated: The love is the cultivation.

original: nams bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid thob cing rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: nams bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid thob cing rnyed pa'o //
translated: The great is the attainment and acquisition of the perfection of the merit of the cultivation of love, which pervades the entire realm of space, and the perfection of the knowledge of the accomplishment of the practice of merit.

original: yang na srog bcad pa dang ma byin par len pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs gzhan du gsungs pa ltar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na srog bcad pa dang ma byin par len pa rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs gzhan du gsungs pa ltar bshad par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the killing and stealing should be explained according to another explanation given by the Lord.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas sems can du 'dzin pa bsad pa na sems can thams cad bsad pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas sems can du 'dzin pa bsad pa na sems can thams cad bsad pa'o //
translated: There, when one kills the grasping of sentient beings by realizing the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment, one kills all sentient beings.

original: 'dis bsad pa'i sems can rnams mi bskyod rdo rje'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams su rgyal ba'i sras su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis bsad pa'i sems can rnams mi bskyod rdo rje'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams su rgyal ba'i sras su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The sentient beings killed by this one will become the sons of the Victor in the Buddha-field of Ak�obhya.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sems can thams cad kyi rgyud kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags phrogs pas na /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sems can thams cad kyi rgyud kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags phrogs pas na /
translated: The wisdom of equality with space, having stolen the habitual tendencies of the afflictions in the mind-streams of all sentient beings,

original: pha rol nor rnams phrogs pa ste //🔽nyon mongs sems can nor zhes bshad //
analyzed: pha rol nor rnams phrogs pa ste // nyon mongs sems can nor zhes bshad //
translated: steals the wealth of others.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: The wealth of sentient beings is explained to be the afflictions.🔽Having emanated as a great wrathful one,

original: nyon mongs 'jig rten khams rnams kyi //🔽dbang byas khro bo cher sprul nas //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'jig rten khams rnams kyi // dbang byas khro bo cher sprul nas //
translated: having subjugated the afflictions and the worldly realms,

original: blo ldan rdo rje mgon po yis //
analyzed: blo ldan rdo rje mgon po yis //
translated: the wise one, the lord of the vajra,

original: rtogs pa'i rgyal po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyal po 'di gsungs so //
translated: taught this King of Realizations.

original: sems can khro ba rab grub phyir //
analyzed: sems can khro ba rab grub phyir //
translated: In order to accomplish the wrath of sentient beings,

original: dri ma med pa'i de nyid ni //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i de nyid ni //
translated: this pure reality

original: snang byed dge ba 'di bshad las //
analyzed: snang byed dge ba 'di bshad las //
translated: is explained as this illuminating virtue.

original: bdag gis bsod nams gang bsags pa //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams gang bsags pa //
translated: Whatever merit I have accumulated

original: de yis 'jig rten ma lus pa //
analyzed: de yis 'jig rten ma lus pa //
translated: by that, may the entire world

original: rdo rje khro chen kun dga' che //
analyzed: rdo rje khro chen kun dga' che //
translated: become a great vajra wrathful one,

original: snying po bsam mi khyab chen gtso //
analyzed: snying po bsam mi khyab chen gtso //
translated: the chief of the great inconceivable essence.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad gtso gyur cig / de kho na nyid snang ba zhes bya ba las phyi rol gyi rdo rje rigs kyi bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad gtso gyur cig / de kho na nyid snang ba zhes bya ba las phyi rol gyi rdo rje rigs kyi bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the external vajra family from the chapter called “Illumination of Reality” is complete.

original: // / de ltar khro bas khro ba spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: // / de ltar khro bas khro ba spang ba'i phyir //
translated: Thus, in order to abandon anger through anger,

original: gnang ba nod pas de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rdo rje'i rigs chen po dang phyi'i rdo rje'i rigs des 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnang ba nod pas de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rdo rje'i rigs chen po dang phyi'i rdo rje'i rigs des 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: the great vajra family that engages in that through receiving permission, and the external vajra family, in order to guide sentient beings to be guided by that,

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa bstan nas /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa bstan nas /
translated: having taught the pledge seal as the chief,

original: da ni gti mug gi gnyen por gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos kyi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa'i padma'i rigs des 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gti mug gi gnyen por gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos kyi phyag rgya gtso bor gyur pa'i padma'i rigs des 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to guide sentient beings to be guided by the lotus family, the chief of which is the perfection of wisdom that is the antidote to delusion, the reality seal,

original: de nas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de nas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: then all tathāgatas, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: The word “then”

original: de ma thag pa ste dang por sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ma thag pa ste dang por sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Immediately after that, immediately after the first meditative stabilization of application, is what is meant.

original: 'dir dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: 'dir dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: Here, the first meditative stabilization of application

original: rdo rje dbyings las gsungs pa'i dang por sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs su rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rdo rje snying po dang / padma'i rigs kyi @12b bdag po rdo rje spyan dang / rdo rje spyan gnyis pa rdo rje sna tshogs sprul pas bsnan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings las gsungs pa'i dang por sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs su rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rdo rje snying po dang / padma'i rigs kyi @12b bdag po rdo rje spyan dang / rdo rje spyan gnyis pa rdo rje sna tshogs sprul pas bsnan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: is to be understood as the emanation of Vajrasattva, Vajragarbha, Vajranetra, the lord of the lotus family, and the second Vajranetra, Vajraviśva, immediately after the first meditative stabilization of application as taught in the Vajra Realm Tantra.

original: de ltar yang ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de ltar yang ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i tshig thos nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i tshig thos nas /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, having heard the words of supplication by all the tathāgatas,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa gal ba der mngon du phyogs te 'dug nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa gal ba der mngon du phyogs te 'dug nas /
translated: approached the blessed Śākyamuni Tathāgata and sat down.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rjes thogs la phyag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje snying po dang / rdo rje lta ba dang / rdo rje sna tshogs su byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rjes thogs la phyag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje snying po dang / rdo rje lta ba dang / rdo rje sna tshogs su byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Then, immediately after the consecration by the Lord, he consecrated Vajrapāṇi, Vajra Essence, Vajra Gaze, and Vajra Variety.

original: de nas des byin gyis brlabs pas de thams cad tha dad par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas des byin gyis brlabs pas de thams cad tha dad par gyur to //
translated: Then, by his consecration, all of them became distinct.

original: thams cad kyi gzugs ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzugs ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered into the meditative absorption of displaying all forms,🔽he emanated the lotus family.

original: padma'i rigs sprul par mdzad do zhes de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma'i rigs sprul par mdzad do zhes de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it will be explained immediately below.

original: thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang de yin pa sa na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang de yin pa sa na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: Since all are also tathāgatas, they are all tathāgatas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra mo dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yang gcig tu 'dus te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra mo dang mnyam pa'i rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yang gcig tu 'dus te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All the world systems are equal to the subtle atoms of the Bhagavat Buddhas, Vairocana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, Amoghasiddhi, and so on, who have gathered together in one place.

original: sngar rdo rje'i rigs kyis 'dul ba'i phyir 'du bar mdzad nas rdo rje sems dpa' la gsol ba btab pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar rdo rje'i rigs kyis 'dul ba'i phyir 'du bar mdzad nas rdo rje sems dpa' la gsol ba btab pa yin la /
translated: Having gathered together in order to tame with the vajra family, they supplicated Vajrasattva.

original: da ni 'chad par 'gyur ba la ltos pas yang gi sgra smos so //
analyzed: da ni 'chad par 'gyur ba la ltos pas yang gi sgra smos so //
translated: Now, in order to explain the following, the word again is mentioned.

original: 'du zhing chogs par mdzad pa de ni gcig tu 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'du zhing chogs par mdzad pa de ni gcig tu 'dus pa'o //
translated: That gathering and assembly is the gathering together in one place.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavat is the one who has conquered the four maras.

original: phyag na rdo rje de nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje de nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: He is Vajrapani himself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs can rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs can rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: He is the one who has the form of Vajrasattva, who abides in the heart of all tathagatas, and is the Great Vajradhara.

original: chos thams cad kyi bdag po ni chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas chos thams cad de padma'i rigs kyi gzugs can gyi sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bdag po ni chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas chos thams cad de padma'i rigs kyi gzugs can gyi sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Lord of all dharmas is a dharma and all of them are that, so all dharmas are the Buddhas, etc. who have the form of the lotus family.

original: de'i bdag po ni mnga' bdag ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag po ni mnga' bdag ste /
translated: His lordship is the master.

original: thams cad byed pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: thams cad byed pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the Lord of Dharma because he does everything.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis @13a * //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis @13a * //
translated: Avalokiteśvara means that all dharmas are pure by nature,

original: rnam par dag pa'o zhes so sor rtog pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'o zhes so sor rtog pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
translated: and he sees the protection of all sentient beings, so he is Avalokita.

original: de la dbang po ni spyan ras gzigs kyi mnga' bdag yin pas na spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de la dbang po ni spyan ras gzigs kyi mnga' bdag yin pas na spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The lord of that is the master of Avalokita, so he is Avalokiteśvara.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba de blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba de blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: This means that what is to be explained is present in the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa des gsol ba btab pa ni don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa des gsol ba btab pa ni don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The request by the Tathāgata with that name of one hundred and eight is the pursuit of the goal.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po de nyid spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi padma'i rigs sprul pa'i phyir mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas gsol ba 'debs pa yin gyis la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po de nyid spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi padma'i rigs sprul pa'i phyir mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas gsol ba 'debs pa yin gyis la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no
translated: That very Great Vajradhara, taking on the form of Avalokitesvara, is supplicated by the one hundred and eight names in order to emanate the lotus family of all the Tathagatas, and not by a Bodhisattva who is abiding in the stage.

original: // padmo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: // padmo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Lotus means naturally pure.

original: sems dpa' ni padma'i sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni padma'i sems dpa'o //
translated: Hero means lotus hero.

original: padma chen zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i gzugs des thams cad du song bas na padma chen po'o //
analyzed: padma chen zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i gzugs des thams cad du song bas na padma chen po'o //
translated: Great lotus means the great lotus because of going everywhere with that form which is naturally pure.

original: 'jig rten dbang po zhes pa ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs kyis bzhugs pa de'i 'jig rten dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po zhes pa ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs kyis bzhugs pa de'i 'jig rten dbang po'o //
translated: Lord of the World means the Lord of the World of that one who abides in the form of the Lord of the World.

original: dbang phyug che zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rnams la don yod par zhags pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pas na dbang phyug chen po'o //🔽spyan ras gzigs dbang po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug che zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rnams la don yod par zhags pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pas na dbang phyug chen po'o // spyan ras gzigs dbang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called Maheśvara is Maheśvara because he abides in the form of a noose for the sake of those to be tamed by the form of Maheśvara.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes gzigs pa dang sems can la gzigs pa 'di la mnga' bas na de ni 'dir spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes gzigs pa dang sems can la gzigs pa 'di la mnga' bas na de ni 'dir spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The one called Avalokiteśvara is so called because he is the lord of the vision of all phenomena as naturally pure and the vision of sentient beings.

original: brtan pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni //
analyzed: brtan pa'i mchog ces bya ba ni //
translated: The one called Sthiraśreṣṭha is so called because he is the best of the steadfast.

original: brtan pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Steadfastness is fearlessness.

original: de dag gi mchog ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skrag pa dang rtag tu bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mchog ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skrag pa dang rtag tu bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the best of those because he is always free from the fear of the concepts of subject and object, due to the nature of the perfection of wisdom's samādhi.

original: rdo rje chos zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdo rje chos zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The one called Vajradharma is so called because vajra is the samādhi of emptiness.

original: de'i chos ni gzugs sna tshogs bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i chos ni gzugs sna tshogs bstan nas /
translated: His Dharma is the teaching of various forms,

original: sems can gyi don mdzad pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ste /
translated: and he acts for the benefit of sentient beings, thus he is Avalokiteśvara.

original: rdo rje chos ni rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni rdo rje chos so //
translated: Vajradharma is Vajradharma.

original: yang na rdo rje dang chos ni rdo rje chos te /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje dang chos ni rdo rje chos te /
translated: Or, vajra and dharma are Vajradharma.

original: stong pa nyid ni gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness is form.

original: gzugs nyid ni stong pa'o zhes gsungs te bdun no //
analyzed: gzugs nyid ni stong pa'o zhes gsungs te bdun no //
translated: Form itself is emptiness.

original: chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba @13b ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes ni chos so //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba @13b ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes ni chos so //
translated: The one called Dharma King is Dharma, which is the wisdom equal to space.

original: des 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdag po'i gzugs kyis rgyal po ltar gsal bar byed pas na chos kyi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: des 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bdag po'i gzugs kyis rgyal po ltar gsal bar byed pas na chos kyi rgyal po'o //
translated: By that, he illuminates like a king with the form of the lord of the world, thus he is the Dharma King.

original: dag pa chen po zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i le shes kyi gzugs kyis thams cad du song ba'i phyir dang bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dag pa chen po zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i le shes kyi gzugs kyis thams cad du song ba'i phyir dang bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Great purity is that very thing, because by the form of wisdom equal to space, he goes everywhere and abandons afflictions along with their traces.

original: dag pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dag pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dag pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dag pa chen po'o //
translated: He is both pure and great, thus he is Great Purity.

original: sems dpa'i rgyal po ni padma'i rigs thams cad kyi lha sems dpa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i rgyal po ni sems dpa'i rgyal po ste /
analyzed: sems dpa'i rgyal po ni padma'i rigs thams cad kyi lha sems dpa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i rgyal po ni sems dpa'i rgyal po ste /
translated: The king of bodhisattvas is the king who assumes the form of a deity, a bodhisattva, of all the lotus families.

original: de dag gi spyi bor 'od dpag tu med pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi spyi bor 'od dpag tu med pa'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he resides on their heads in the form of Amitābha.

original: blo gros che zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi blo gros chen po'o //
analyzed: blo gros che zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi blo gros chen po'o //
translated: Great intellect is the great intellect of all the tathāgatas, because he resides by means of the perfection of wisdom.

original: padma'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis padma nyid dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: padma'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis padma nyid dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Lotus nature is the nature of a lotus, because of the samādhi of natural purity, the lotus itself is free from all stains.

original: padma'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na padma'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: padma'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na padma'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Lotus nature is the nature of that, because of the samādhi of natural purity.

original: padma che zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i gzugs de nyid kyis thams cad du song ba'i phyir /
analyzed: padma che zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i gzugs de nyid kyis thams cad du song ba'i phyir /
translated: Great lotus is the great lotus of all the tathāgatas, because of the form of natural purity, it pervades everywhere.

original: padma yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na padma chen po'o //
analyzed: padma yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na padma chen po'o //
translated: He is the great lotus, since he is the great lotus.

original: padma'i mgon po zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi padma de'i mgon po ni padma'i mgon po'o //
analyzed: padma'i mgon po zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi padma de'i mgon po ni padma'i mgon po'o //
translated: The lord of the lotus family is the lord of that lotus.

original: des padma'i rigs la sogs pa dbang du byed pa ste /
analyzed: des padma'i rigs la sogs pa dbang du byed pa ste /
translated: He subjugates the lotus family, etc.

original: mtshan bdun no //
analyzed: mtshan bdun no //
translated: These are the seven names.

original: padma las byung zhes bya ba ni padma'i rgyu las byung bas na padma las byung ngo //
analyzed: padma las byung zhes bya ba ni padma'i rgyu las byung bas na padma las byung ngo //
translated: He is born from the lotus, since he is born from the cause of the lotus.

original: padma'i rigs thams cad rdo rje padma'i gzugs las byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: padma'i rigs thams cad rdo rje padma'i gzugs las byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The entire lotus family is born from the form of the vajra lotus.

original: / pad bzang 'od ces bya ba ni padma'i rnam pa can gyi 'od zer 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / pad bzang 'od ces bya ba ni padma'i rnam pa can gyi 'od zer 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the light of the good lotus, since he emits light rays in the form of lotuses.

original: de skad du yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka nas padmo lta bu'i 'od zer kha dog dang / gzugs dang / rtags dang spyod lam rnam pa du ma 'byung ste /
analyzed: de skad du yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka nas padmo lta bu'i 'od zer kha dog dang / gzugs dang / rtags dang spyod lam rnam pa du ma 'byung ste /
translated: Thus it is said that from the hearts of all the Tathagatas there come forth light rays in the form of lotuses, of various colors, forms, signs, and deportments,

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i thugs kar zhugs so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i thugs kar zhugs so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they enter into the heart of the noble Avalokitesvara.

original: padma dag pa zhes bya ba ni padma yis dag pas na padma dag pa ste /
analyzed: padma dag pa zhes bya ba ni padma yis dag pas na padma dag pa ste /
translated: The one called “pure lotus” is pure lotus because of purity by lotus.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dri ma thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dri ma thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the concentration of natural purity, because it abandons all stains.

original: rab dag byed ces bya ba ni shin tu dag par byed pa'i phyir nar bdag go //🔽padma'i @14a * //
analyzed: rab dag byed ces bya ba ni shin tu dag par byed pa'i phyir nar bdag go // padma'i @14a * //
translated: It is the one called “very pure” because it makes very pure.

original: ting nge 'dzin des rang dang gzhan gyi bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'khrul par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin des rang dang gzhan gyi bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'khrul par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that lotus concentration, it makes pure the stains of affliction of self and other together with their instincts.

original: rdo rje padmo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje padma'i gzugs kyis so //🔽pad mchog sku zhes ya ba ni padma bzang po ni padma mchog ste /
analyzed: rdo rje padmo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje padma'i gzugs kyis so // pad mchog sku zhes ya ba ni padma bzang po ni padma mchog ste /
translated: The one called “vajra lotus” is by the form of a vajra lotus.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs so //
translated: The one called “lotus supreme body” is the lotus supreme, the form of the Bhagavat’s seal.

original: de'i sku mdog dkar dmar gyi sku mnga' ba ni pad mchog sku'o //
analyzed: de'i sku mdog dkar dmar gyi sku mnga' ba ni pad mchog sku'o //
translated: Its body is red and white, the body of the lotus supreme.

original: padmo padmo zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa padma'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la padmo'i padma zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padmo padmo zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa padma'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa gang yin pa de la padmo'i padma zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Lotus lotus is the lotus of the Blessed One Amitābha, who abides in the lotus samādhi. This will be explained later as lotus lotus.

original: de skad du yang /🔽bdag nyid kyis ni bdag nyid dang // rdo rje chos kyi ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: de skad du yang / bdag nyid kyis ni bdag nyid dang // rdo rje chos kyi ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: And it will be explained:🔽Abiding in the vajra-dharma samādhi,🔽one should meditate on the lotus lotus.

original: padmo'i padmo bsgoms na ni //
analyzed: padmo'i padmo bsgoms na ni //
translated: By oneself, for oneself,

original: zad mi shes pa'i go 'phang thob //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa'i go 'phang thob //
translated: one attains the inexhaustible state.

original: ces 'chad par 'gyur bas te gzugs su bya ba yin te mtshan bdun no //
analyzed: ces 'chad par 'gyur bas te gzugs su bya ba yin te mtshan bdun no //
translated: This is the seventh form.

original: sna tshogs chen po zhas bya ba ni sna tshogs kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na /
analyzed: sna tshogs chen po zhas bya ba ni sna tshogs kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na /
translated: As for mahā-vaidūrya, it is both variegated and great,

original: sna tshogs chen po ste thams cad kyi gzugs 'dzin pas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs chen po ste thams cad kyi gzugs 'dzin pas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: so it is mahā-vaidūrya. It is of the nature of taming beings by assuming all forms.

original: snang ba che zhes bya ba ni snang ba yang yin la chen pa yang de yin pas na snang ba che ste /
analyzed: snang ba che zhes bya ba ni snang ba yang yin la chen pa yang de yin pas na snang ba che ste /
translated: As for mahā-prabhā, it is both light and great, so it is mahā-prabhā.

original: padma nyi ma'i 'od kyis nam mkha' thams cad 'gengs pa'o //
analyzed: padma nyi ma'i 'od kyis nam mkha' thams cad 'gengs pa'o //
translated: The lotus sun light fills all of space.

original: dgos pa chen po zhes bya ba ni dgos pa chen po 'di la mnga' bas na dgos pa che ste /
analyzed: dgos pa chen po zhes bya ba ni dgos pa chen po 'di la mnga' bas na dgos pa che ste /
translated: Great purpose means that because he possesses this great purpose, he is of great purpose.

original: sems can gyi don du des thams cad pa'i gzugs bstan nas nam mkha' thams cad 'gengs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du des thams cad pa'i gzugs bstan nas nam mkha' thams cad 'gengs pa'o //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, he displays all pervading forms and fills all of space.

original: de dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs zhes bya ba ni chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Similar to that means that the great one is the Tathagata.

original: 'di'i dpe de dang mtshungs pas na che dang mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i dpe de dang mtshungs pas na che dang mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Because this example is similar to that, it is similar to the great one.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mtshungs zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mtshungs zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: It means similar to the Tathagata.

original: / sku dang gsung dang thugs rje ltar gyur pa nam mkha'i khams thams cad du rtag tu bzhugs pa'i gzugs dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: / sku dang gsung dang thugs rje ltar gyur pa nam mkha'i khams thams cad du rtag tu bzhugs pa'i gzugs dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is similar to the form that always abides in all realms of space, like the body, speech, and mind of the great one.

original: brtan pa chen po zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo de nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab cing skrag pa med pas na brtan pa chen po'o //
analyzed: brtan pa chen po zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo de nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab cing skrag pa med pas na brtan pa chen po'o //
translated: The great steadfast one is the great steadfast one because that essence of samādhi, which is naturally pure, pervades the entire realm of space and is fearless.

original: dpa' bo che zhes bya ba ni rang nyid dri ma med pa'i rdo rje 'chang ba'i gzugs kyis dmigs pa thams cad la spyod pa'i sems can skrag cing 'jigs par byed pas na dpa' bo che'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo che zhes bya ba ni rang nyid dri ma med pa'i rdo rje 'chang ba'i gzugs kyis dmigs pa thams cad la spyod pa'i sems can skrag cing 'jigs par byed pas na dpa' bo che'o //
translated: The great hero is the great hero because the form of Vairocana, who is himself stainless, terrifies and frightens sentient beings who engage in all objects.

original: dpa' chen zhes bya ba ni dpa' ba ni gzi brjid de gzi brjid can rnams kyi nang na gzi brjid @14b che bas na dpa'i chen no //
analyzed: dpa' chen zhes bya ba ni dpa' ba ni gzi brjid de gzi brjid can rnams kyi nang na gzi brjid @14b che bas na dpa'i chen no //
translated: The great hero is the great hero because he is a hero, that is, splendor, and he is the greatest splendor among those who are splendid.

original: rdo rje nyi ma 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i gzugs kyis rgyal srid thams cad 'phrog par byed pas na dpa' bo che ba ste mtshan bdun no //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i gzugs kyis rgyal srid thams cad 'phrog par byed pas na dpa' bo che ba ste mtshan bdun no //
translated: The great hero is the great hero because the form of Vajrasūrya, the king of the cakravartins, seizes all kingdoms.

original: sems can bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa la bsam pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa la bsam pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The thought of sentient beings is explained as the desire of the thought of all sentient beings.

original: theg ba che zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi sems de nyid goms pa'i stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba de'i phyir theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: theg ba che zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi sems de nyid goms pa'i stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba de'i phyir theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the Great Vehicle because the very thought of all sentient beings becomes the nature of the path of the bodhisattva together with its result through the power of cultivation.

original: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni rnal 'byor che'o ;
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni rnal 'byor che'o ;
translated: The Great Yoga is the nature of all things, both moving and unmoving.

original: / de skad du yang /
analyzed: / de skad du yang /
translated: And it will be explained:

original: phyag rgya chen po'i ting 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i ting 'dzin gyis //
translated: Through the samadhi of the Great Seal,

original: de nyid chen po rjod byed cing //
analyzed: de nyid chen po rjod byed cing //
translated: the Great Reality is expressed.

original: thams cad re re'ang bdag yin par //
analyzed: thams cad re re'ang bdag yin par //
translated: The meditation of the thought that each and every thing is the self

original: sgom pa sems pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgom pa sems pa'i sbyor ba'o // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the application of the mind.

original: tshangs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams 'dul bar byed pas na mes po che'o ;
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams 'dul bar byed pas na mes po che'o ;
translated: The Great Grandfather is the Great Grandfather because he disciplines sentient beings to be disciplined by the form of Brahma.

original: / bde za zhes bya ba ni sha ma ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: / bde za zhes bya ba ni sha ma ni bde ba'o //
translated: The one called Sukharasa is the bliss of the vulva.

original: de la spyod pas na za ba'o //
analyzed: de la spyod pas na za ba'o //
translated: He who enjoys that is Sukharasa.

original: yang na lha chen pos 'dul ba'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na lha chen pos 'dul ba'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, in order to take care of those beings who are to be disciplined by Mahesvara,

original: de'i gzugs ston pas na bde za'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs ston pas na bde za'o //
translated: he displays his form as Sukharasa.

original: bde byed ces bya ba ni bde bar byed pas na bde byed do //
analyzed: bde byed ces bya ba ni bde bar byed pas na bde byed do //
translated: The one called Sukha is Sukha because he brings about bliss.

original: dag pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dag pa chos kyi dbyings de nyid 'di la mnga' bas na dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: dag pa'i don zhes bya ba ni dag pa chos kyi dbyings de nyid 'di la mnga' bas na dag pa'i don to //
translated: The one called Artha is Artha because he possesses that very pure dharmadhatu.

original: sangs rgyas padmo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas padmo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su 'byung ba ste /
translated: The one called Buddhapadma is the one who arises in the place of Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas kyang yin la padma yang yin pas na sangs rgyas padma ste mtshan brgyad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang yin la padma yang yin pas na sangs rgyas padma ste mtshan brgyad do //
translated: He is a Buddha and also a lotus, so he is Buddhapadma, the eighth name.

original: chos kyi de nyid ni /
analyzed: chos kyi de nyid ni /
translated: The reality of the Dharma

original: padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor te //
translated: is the mandala of the Padma family.

original: de rnams rkyang kho na nyid ni chos kyi de nyid ngo //
analyzed: de rnams rkyang kho na nyid ni chos kyi de nyid ngo //
translated: The reality of just those is the reality of the Dharma.

original: mi mnyam med pas zur bzhi mnyam //
analyzed: mi mnyam med pas zur bzhi mnyam //
translated: It has four corners because it is without inequality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa de'i don ni 'dir chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa de'i don ni 'dir chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of that, which was explained by the above and so on, is the meaning of the reality of the Dharma here.

original: dam pa'i chos dam pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yin pas na dam pa'i chos te padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor re //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dam pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos yin pas na dam pa'i chos te padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor re //
translated: The holy Dharma is the Dharma of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and so it is the holy Dharma, the mandala of the Lotus family.

original: dag pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dag pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The pure Dharma is

original: dkyil 'khor de nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs sbong ba de'i phyir //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs sbong ba de'i phyir //
translated: that very mandala, because it abandons desire and so on.

original: dag pa yang yin la chos kyang de yin pas na dag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dag pa yang yin la chos kyang de yin pas na dag pa'i chos so //
translated: It is pure and it is the Dharma, and so it is the pure Dharma.

original: chos rab byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rab byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The Dharma activity is

original: padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid padma'i rigs kyi ting nge 'dzin des skyed par @15a * //🔽byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid padma'i rigs kyi ting nge 'dzin des skyed par @15a * // byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that very mandala of the Lotus family, because it generates the meditative stabilization of the Lotus family.

original: bzang po'i chos byed pa'i phyir chos rab byed do //
analyzed: bzang po'i chos byed pa'i phyir chos rab byed do //
translated: It is the Dharma activity because it performs the good Dharma.

original: chos chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The great Dharma is

original: padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid rgyud phyi ma phyi ma las bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad du song bas na chos kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na chos chen po'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid rgyud phyi ma phyi ma las bshad pa'i tshul gyis thams cad du song bas na chos kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na chos chen po'o //
translated: Since that maṇḍala of the lotus family is the Dharma and is also great because it pervades everywhere in the manner explained in the Later Tantra of the Later Tantra, it is the great Dharma.

original: chos bzang mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos bzang mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme good Dharma is

original: chos dge ba'i chos ni chos bzang po ste /
analyzed: chos dge ba'i chos ni chos bzang po ste /
translated: the good Dharma, the virtuous Dharma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos de'i mchog ni chos bzang mchog ste dkyil 'khor nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos de'i mchog ni chos bzang mchog ste dkyil 'khor nyid do //
translated: The supreme good Dharma is the supreme of those Dharmas of the perfection of wisdom, which is the maṇḍala itself.🔽The wheel of Dharma is the nature of all maṇḍalas of the lotus family.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gro ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gro ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo mtshan bdun no //🔽sangs rgyas sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo mtshan bdun no // sangs rgyas sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: the wheel of Dharma has seven characteristics.🔽The buddhas and sentient beings are🔽the buddhas, which is an illustration.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sems dpa' ni sems can no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sems dpa' ni sems can no //
translated: The sentient beings are the sentient beings of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa'i spyi bo na bzhugs pa des nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa'i spyi bo na bzhugs pa des nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is seated on the head of the Tathagata Amitabha.

original: sems bzang mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems bzang mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The one called good mind supreme

original: dag pa'i sems ni sems bzang ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i sems ni sems bzang ste /
translated: is the good mind, the pure mind,

original: sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa de dag gi mchog tu gyur pas na sems bzang mchog ste padma'i rigs kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa de dag gi mchog tu gyur pas na sems bzang mchog ste padma'i rigs kyi bdag po'o //
translated: the supreme of all good minds, the lord of the lotus family.

original: chos kyi sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called dharma mind

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag las byung ba'i chos kyi sems ni sems dpa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag las byung ba'i chos kyi sems ni sems dpa'i chos so //
translated: is the mind of dharma, the mind of the purity of all dharmas.

original: sems mchog 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems mchog 'dzin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called mind supreme holder

original: dge ba'i sems ni sems kyi mchog ste //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems ni sems kyi mchog ste //
translated: is the supreme mind, the virtuous mind,

original: sems can kun gyi sems gang yin //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi sems gang yin //
translated: the mind of all sentient beings,

original: brtan phyir sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: brtan phyir sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
translated: called mind hero because of its stability.

original: zhes gang la 'chad par 'gyur ba ni 'dir sems dpa' mchog 'dzin pa des na sems mchog 'dzin zhes bya ba ;
analyzed: zhes gang la 'chad par 'gyur ba ni 'dir sems dpa' mchog 'dzin pa des na sems mchog 'dzin zhes bya ba ;
translated: As will be explained, here the supreme mind is the holder, therefore it is called the mind supreme holder.

original: sems dpa'i dam pa zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i rdo rje dang mtshungs pa'i sems de nyid rdo rje'i gzugs can yin pas na sems dpa' dam pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'i dam pa zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i rdo rje dang mtshungs pa'i sems de nyid rdo rje'i gzugs can yin pas na sems dpa' dam pa'o //
translated: The best of beings is the best of beings because that very mind which is like a vajra, as just explained, has the nature of a vajra.

original: sems mchog ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems dpa' dam pa de nyid legs par shes pas na sems mchog ces so //
analyzed: sems mchog ces bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems dpa' dam pa de nyid legs par shes pas na sems mchog ces so //
translated: The best of minds is the best of minds because it is well known as the best of beings, as just explained.

original: sems can sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The being who is a being is

original: rdo rje'i bdag nyid du bsgoms pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa de nyid sems dpar gyis brlabs pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje sems dpar gyur pa'i sems ni sems can sems can sems dpa' zhes bya ste mtshan bdun no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag nyid du bsgoms pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa de nyid sems dpar gyis brlabs pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje sems dpar gyur pa'i sems ni sems can sems can sems dpa' zhes bya ste mtshan bdun no //
translated: the being who is a being because, by meditating on the nature of the vajra, one becomes a vajra being on the moon disc, and that very being is consecrated as Vajrasattva.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang @15b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang @15b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Avalokiteśvara is

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i so sor rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gzigs pa'i phyir spyan ras gzigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i so sor rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gzigs pa'i phyir spyan ras gzigs so //
translated: Avalokiteśvara because all tathāgatas see the discernment of natural purity.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gi gzugs 'dzin pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang ngo //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gi gzugs 'dzin pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang ngo //
translated: Avalokitesvara is the lord of compassion, and he is the lord of compassion because he assumes the form of Avalokitesvara.

original: mgon po mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mgon po mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the supreme protector means

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi skyabs dang mgon byed pa de dag gi nang na mchog yin pas na mgon po mchog go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi skyabs dang mgon byed pa de dag gi nang na mchog yin pas na mgon po mchog go //
translated: that he is the supreme protector among the bodhisattvas who are the refuge and protector of sentient beings.

original: mgon po chen po zhes bya ba ni mgon po yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na mgon po chen po ste /
analyzed: mgon po chen po zhes bya ba ni mgon po yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na mgon po chen po ste /
translated: The phrase the great protector means that he is the great protector because he is the protector and great.

original: thams cad kyi gzugs su bstan nas sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i phyir dang ; thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzugs su bstan nas sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i phyir dang ; thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the protector because he shows himself in all forms and protects all sentient beings. He is great because he goes everywhere.

original: rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba ni byed brag tu gzigs pa ni rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba ni byed brag tu gzigs pa ni rnam par gzigs so //
translated: The phrase he looks means that he looks with a special look.

original: gang la yongs su bskyab pa'i don yin zhe na /🔽snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang la yongs su bskyab pa'i don yin zhe na / snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is it that he looks at?🔽 The phrase the light means

original: ye shes kyi snang bas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang bas so //
translated: that he looks with the light of wisdom.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi gzugs kyis sems can gyi don byed pas ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi gzugs kyis sems can gyi don byed pas ni snang ba'o //
translated: It is light because it acts for the sake of sentient beings by means of the form of the world and the world of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas don du gnyer ba ni 'jig rten don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas don du gnyer ba ni 'jig rten don to //
translated: The world's aim is the aim of the world.

original: 'jig rten mgon khyod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon khyod ces bya ba ni /
translated: You, O Protector of the world, is addressed to him.

original: ming gi sgo nas 'di skad btags pa yin no //
analyzed: ming gi sgo nas 'di skad btags pa yin no //
translated: It is addressed to him by way of his name.

original: mtshan brgyad do //🔽'jig rten yi ge zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan brgyad do // 'jig rten yi ge zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These are the eight epithets.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yi ge ni 'jig rten yi ge ste ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yi ge ni 'jig rten yi ge ste ;
translated: The world's letters are the letters of the world.

original: mi zad pa'i phyir na yi ge zhes bya ba'i tshig go //🔽yi ge che zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i phyir na yi ge zhes bya ba'i tshig go // yi ge che zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are called letters because they do not perish.

original: mi zad pa'i phyir yi ge che ste /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i phyir yi ge che ste /
translated: The great letters are great because they do not perish.

original: yi ge chen po ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis thams cad du song ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽yi ge mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yi ge chen po ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis thams cad du song ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to // yi ge mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The great letters are great because they are the nature of the Dharma-element and extend everywhere.

original: 'jig rten pa 'ga' zhig yi ge 'ga' zhig 'dod ba de dag gi nang na mchog yin pas na mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa 'ga' zhig yi ge 'ga' zhig 'dod ba de dag gi nang na mchog yin pas na mdzes pa'o //
translated: The supreme letters are the most beautiful because they are the best of the letters that some people in the world desire.

original: yi ge 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yi ge 'dra zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “like the letters” means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i gzugs dang 'dra ba'i yi ge de la 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i gzugs dang 'dra ba'i yi ge de la 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: that the letters are like the form of that Tathāgata.

original: yi ge'i yi ge zhes pa na /
analyzed: yi ge'i yi ge zhes pa na /
translated: The phrase “the letters of the letters” means

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku ni yi ge'o //

original: thams cad spyan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad spyan zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'khor lo yi ge zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo yi ge zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “the wheel of letters” means

analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rim gyis 'pho bas na 'khor lo ste / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / rang @16a * //
translated: that the wheel is the transmission of the teachings in sequence to the mindstreams of disciples.🔽The wheel of letters is the door of liberation that is emptiness, signlessness,

analyzed: bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo de nyid mi zad pas na yi ge ste /

analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid yi ge 'khor lo'i mtshan bdun no //
translated: The wheel of letters is the seven epithets of the nature of those letters.

analyzed: phyag na padmo zhes bya ba ni phyag na padmo mnga' ba ni phyag na padma'o // phyag chen po zhes bya ba ni /

original: phyag chen po mnga' bas na phyag chen po ste /
analyzed: phyag chen po mnga' bas na phyag chen po ste /

analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyang phyag gis khyab pa'o //
translated: He is the one who covers the whole realm of space with his hand.

original: dbugs 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called âśvâsa is the one who gives relief.

original: ngan song du song ba dang / mya ngan dang / shi pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa'i sems can rnams bsrung ba'i phyir na dbugs 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song du song ba dang / mya ngan dang / shi pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas skrag pa'i sems can rnams bsrung ba'i phyir na dbugs 'byin pa'o //

analyzed: sbyin pa po zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa'o // sangs rgyas chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called dâna-pati is the one who fulfills the wishes of all beings by means of the Akâçagarbha-samâdhi.

analyzed: theg pa gsum ston pa'i chos kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos ni sangs rgyas chos so //
