original: sangs rgyas che zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas che zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called buddha-mahasattva is the one who is a great being of the buddhas.

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i gzugs kyis thams cad du song bas na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na sangs rgyas chen po'o // sangs rgyas bdag nyid ces bya ba ni /

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rdul phra rab las bsgrub pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rdul phra rab las bsgrub pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bdag nyid do //
translated: He is the embodiment of all Buddhas because he is the embodiment of all Buddhas.

original: mtshan bdun no //🔽sangs rgyas gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan bdun no // sangs rgyas gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is the sevenfold name.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su padma sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gzugs so //🔽gzugs chen po zhes bya ba ni /

original: thams cad kyi gzugs kyis nam mkha'i khams spros pas na gzugs chen po'o //🔽rdo rje'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzugs kyis nam mkha'i khams spros pas na gzugs chen po'o // rdo rje'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: thams cad kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pa'i phyir rdo rje'i gzugs so //🔽gzugs bzang 'chang zhes bya ba ni //
translated: He is the vajra-form because he abides in the form of all seals.🔽He is the bearer of the beautiful form because he is the embodiment of all forms.

original: gzugs bzang po lta bas chog mi shes pa mnga' bas na gzugs bzang 'chang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs bzang po lta bas chog mi shes pa mnga' bas na gzugs bzang 'chang ngo //

original: chos kyi snang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: ma dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rnams kyis snang bar byed pas na chos kyi snang ba'o //

original: gzi brjid mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzi brjid mchog ces bya ba ni /

analyzed: dge ba'i gzi brjid ji lta ji lta bu'i gzi brjid mchog de lta bu de la mnga' bas na gzi brjid mchog go //
translated: is supreme splendor, because he possesses that kind of supreme splendor, whatever it may be, of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rdo rje gzi brjid ni 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i gzugs kyis rgyal po chos thams cad kyi gzi brjid zil gyis gnon par bzhugs @16b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rdo rje gzi brjid ni 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i gzugs kyis rgyal po chos thams cad kyi gzi brjid zil gyis gnon par bzhugs @16b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great bodhisattva Vajra-tejas is the one who shines in the form of a universal monarch, because he abides as the king who overwhelms the splendor of all phenomena.

analyzed: gzugs de nyid kyis khams gsum pa ma lus pa'i sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten snang bar byed pas na /

original: 'jig rten snang byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed do //

original: mtshan bdun no //
analyzed: mtshan bdun no //

analyzed: padmo'i dpal gyi mgon po zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: padma'i rigs skyed par byed pa'i padmo'i dpal de ni mgon po ste bdag po'o //

original: mgon po mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mgon po mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme protector is

analyzed: sems can rnams skyob pas na mgon po'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa de dag gis 'gro ba rnams 'dul bar byed pas na mchog go //

original: chos dpal mgon po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos dpal mgon po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The glory of Dharma is the protector,

analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ni chos so //
translated: the Dharma is the wisdom that has the nature of the four correct knowledges.

analyzed: dpal ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //

original: mgon ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mgon ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one possessing the protector is

analyzed: mngon po rnam par snang mdzad de /

analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs kyis padma'i rigs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir mgon po de la mnga' bas na mgon ldan pa'o //

original: tshangs pa'i mgon po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mgon po zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: stong gsum pa'i bdag bo tshangs pa'i gzugs kyis bdag po mdzad pas na tshangs pa'i mgon po'o //

analyzed: tshangs pa chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is the great Brahma is

original: tshangs sras zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs sras zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: sgren ma lta bu yin pas na sgron ma snang ba'o //

original: snang ba'i gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: shin tu snang ba zhes bya ba ni /

translated: Great eye means

original: lha'i spyan yang de yin la /
analyzed: lha'i spyan yang de yin la /
translated: it is the eye of the gods,

original: chen po yang de yin @17b pas na spyan chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin @17b pas na spyan chen po'o //
translated: and it is great, thus it is the great eye.

original: chos spyan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos spyan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Dharma eye means

original: yul yongs su ma spangs par mkhyen nas chos ston pa gang yin pa de ni chos spyan no //
analyzed: yul yongs su ma spangs par mkhyen nas chos ston pa gang yin pa de ni chos spyan no //
translated: the dharma eye is that which teaches the dharma after knowing without abandoning the object.

original: gzigs pa chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzigs pa chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Great seer means

original: shes rab kyi spyan gyis ngo bo la gzigs pa chen po 'di la mnga' bas na gzigs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan gyis ngo bo la gzigs pa chen po 'di la mnga' bas na gzigs pa chen po'o //
translated: Since he is the great seer who sees the essence with the eye of wisdom, he is the great seer.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of meditative concentration is as follows:

original: ting nge 'dzin ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes su des pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes su des pa'o //
translated: Meditative concentration is the knowledge of meditative concentration that all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The all-pervading is as follows:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thams cad pa ni khyod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thams cad pa ni khyod do //
translated: You are the all-pervading of all the Blessed Buddhas by the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rdo rje spyan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje spyan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vajra eye is as follows:

original: sha'i spyan gyi ngo bo ni rdo rje spyan te /
analyzed: sha'i spyan gyi ngo bo ni rdo rje spyan te /
translated: The essence of the flesh eye is the vajra eye.

original: rdo rje spyan des nye bar mtshon pa ni rdo rje spyan zhes bshad pa ste mtshan bdun yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje spyan des nye bar mtshon pa ni rdo rje spyan zhes bshad pa ste mtshan bdun yin no //
translated: That which is characterized by that vajra eye is explained as the vajra eye. These are the seven epithets.🔽Thus, the praise in one hundred and eight epithets is stated:

original: de ltar mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni bdag nyid kun gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni bdag nyid kun gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The benefits of praising with the one hundred and eight epithets are stated: By all of oneself and so on.

original: 'ga' zhig bshad ma thag pa 'dis bdag nyid kun gyis dngos po thams cad kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bshad ma thag pa 'dis bdag nyid kun gyis dngos po thams cad kyi sgo nas so //
translated: Some, by all things, through all of one's own nature.

original: yon tan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi yon tan no //
translated: The qualities of the qualities of the reason.

original: khyod kyi mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa rnams ni khyod kyi mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa rnams ni khyod kyi mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: Your one hundred and eight names is the recitation of your one hundred and eight names.

original: bstod dam ni bstod pa'i bsam pas bstod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bstod dam ni bstod pa'i bsam pas bstod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Praise is the desire to praise with the intention to praise.

original: sgom par byed pa ni don mngon du byed pa gang yin pa des kyang 'jig rten gyi dbang po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgom par byed pa ni don mngon du byed pa gang yin pa des kyang 'jig rten gyi dbang po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who meditates on it becomes like the Lord of the World through the realization of the meaning.

original: dpa' bo khyod la gsol btab pa //
analyzed: dpa' bo khyod la gsol btab pa //
translated: The hero, having supplicated you,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: gus pa sngon du 'gro bas don du gnyer bas gsol ba 'de bas pa ni don gyi ched kar gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: gus pa sngon du 'gro bas don du gnyer bas gsol ba 'de bas pa ni don gyi ched kar gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: the supplication with devotion and longing, supplicating for the sake of the meaning.

original: dmigs pa thams cad las rnam par rgyal bas na dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad las rnam par rgyal bas na dpa' bo'o //
translated: The hero is victorious over all objects.

original: rang gi rigs ni bskyed nas kyang //
analyzed: rang gi rigs ni bskyed nas kyang //
translated: Having generated one's own lineage,

original: zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma'i rigs bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the generation of the lotus lineage.

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor dam pa ni //
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor dam pa ni //
translated: The holy mandala of the Dharma

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rang gi bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa khyod kyis bshad du gsol zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rang gi bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa khyod kyis bshad du gsol zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: is the request of the Tathagatas, saying: “Please explain the supreme nature of the mandala of the Dharma.”

original: thub pa chen pos bshad du gsol //
analyzed: thub pa chen pos bshad du gsol //
translated: The great Sage should explain

original: zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa'o //
translated: is the great Sage, because he is endowed with the three: the Sage of body, the Sage of speech, and the Sage of mind.

original: thub pa rnams kyi nang na thub pa yin pas na thub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: thub pa rnams kyi nang na thub pa yin pas na thub pa chen po'o //
translated: He is the great Sage, because he is the Sage of the Sages.

original: de la lus thub pa ni /
analyzed: de la lus thub pa ni /
translated: Therein, the Sage of body is

original: lus kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnam pa gsum dang bral ba'o //
translated: free from the three types of unwholesome paths of action of the body.

original: ngag gi las kyi lam @18a * //
analyzed: ngag gi las kyi lam @18a * //
translated: The Sage of speech is

original: rnam pa bzhi dang bral bas na ngag thub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi dang bral bas na ngag thub pa'o //
translated: free from the four types of unwholesome paths of action of speech.🔽The Sage of mind is

original: yid kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnam pa gsum dang bral bas na yid thub pa'o //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yid kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnam pa gsum dang bral bas na yid thub pa'o // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: free from the three types of unwholesome paths of action of mind.🔽Then, etc.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa'o //
translated: The word “then” means immediately after.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs 'dzin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i tshig thos nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs 'dzin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i tshig thos nas /
translated: Immediately after the request of all the Tathagatas, Avalokitesvara, assuming the form of Vajrapani, having heard the words of request of all the Tathagatas,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa ga la ba der mngon du phyogs te 'dug nas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa ga la ba der mngon du phyogs te 'dug nas so //
translated: he sat facing the place where the Blessed Shakyamuni Tathagata was.

original: 'dug nas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: 'dug nas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: Having sat there, what did he do?

original: rdo rje padmo de rang gi thugs kar bzhag ste /
analyzed: rdo rje padmo de rang gi thugs kar bzhag ste /
translated: He placed the vajra lotus in his heart center.

original: ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the expression of the purpose.

original: dang por sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis chos kyi sku'i dbang bskur ba gang yin pa des dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: dang por sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis chos kyi sku'i dbang bskur ba gang yin pa des dbang bskur ro //
translated: First, at the time of completing the preparatory samadhi, he was empowered by the empowerment of the dharmakaya of all the Tathagatas.

original: de nas rang gi thugs ka'i phyogs su phyag g-yon pa brkyang ba'i tshul gyis bzung nas gnas pa la /
analyzed: de nas rang gi thugs ka'i phyogs su phyag g-yon pa brkyang ba'i tshul gyis bzung nas gnas pa la /
translated: Then, he held it in the direction of his heart center, as if extending his left hand, and remained there.

original: phyag g-yas pas 'byed pa'i tshul du mdzad nas 'di ched du brjod do //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas 'byed pa'i tshul du mdzad nas 'di ched du brjod do //
translated: He opened his right hand, and uttered this meaningful expression:

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: “Amazing!” means “astonishing!”

original: rab tu dag pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu dag pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “stage of complete purity”

original: mchog tu gyur pas na rab tu'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pas na rab tu'o //
translated: is “complete” because it is supreme.

original: ci'i phyir 'di rab tu dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di rab tu dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it complete?

original: gang gi phyir dri ma thams cad dang bral bas na dag pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri ma thams cad dang bral bas na dag pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is free from all stains, it is called “pure.”

original: de su'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: de su'i yin zhe na /
translated: Whose is it?

original: rdo rje padmo 'di dag gi / zhes smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje padmo 'di dag gi / zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, “of these vajra and lotus.”

original: 'dir ci'i phyir ngo mtshar che zhe na /🔽pha yin bdag gi bu yang yin //
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir ngo mtshar che zhe na / pha yin bdag gi bu yang yin //
translated: Why is it astonishing here?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “He is the father, and I am his son.”

original: pha ni rdo rje padma'i ste /
analyzed: pha ni rdo rje padma'i ste /
translated: The father is the vajra lotus,

original: 'di yang bdag nyid yin la bu yang bdag yin pas na /
analyzed: 'di yang bdag nyid yin la bu yang bdag yin pas na /
translated: and I am myself, and I am also his son.

original: bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Because he is to be generated, he is astonishing.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'di gang yin pa yang bdag yin la bdag gang yin pa'ang 'di yin pas na rdo rje padmas 'dul ba rnams kyis de ltar mthong ba yin no //🔽'jig rten dbang phyug las padma 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di gang yin pa yang bdag yin la bdag gang yin pa'ang 'di yin pas na rdo rje padmas 'dul ba rnams kyis de ltar mthong ba yin no // 'jig rten dbang phyug las padma 'byung la /
translated: Since this is also the self, and the self is also this, those who are disciplined by the vajra and lotus see it in this way.🔽It is amazing that the lotus arises from Lokeśvara,

original: de las kyang 'jig rten dbang phyug tu byung ba 'di ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de las kyang 'jig rten dbang phyug tu byung ba 'di ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: and that Lokeśvara arises from the lotus.

original: rigs 'di byin gyis brlab par mdzod //
analyzed: rigs 'di byin gyis brlab par mdzod //
translated: Bless this family.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is said

original: rang gi rigs byin gyis brlabs nas gang gis sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir bdag la gtad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs byin gyis brlabs nas gang gis sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir bdag la gtad pa'o //
translated: because, having blessed one’s own family, one is entrusted to oneself in order to benefit sentient beings.🔽This family is

original: rigs 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi thugs kar bzhag pa gang yin pa 'di'o //
analyzed: rigs 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi thugs kar bzhag pa gang yin pa 'di'o //
translated: the one that is placed in one’s heart.

original: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is taught as follows.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das @18b khyed kyi thugs la rdo rje 'chang chan po'i gzugs kyis padma'i rigs su rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa de bdag cag gi rigs kyi nus pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das @18b khyed kyi thugs la rdo rje 'chang chan po'i gzugs kyis padma'i rigs su rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa de bdag cag gi rigs kyi nus pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the form of Great Vajradhara, which is in the lotus family in the heart of the Blessed One, is placed in one’s heart in order to generate the power of one’s own family.

original: bdag la de gtad pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la de gtad pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: I have entrusted it to you, not to anyone else.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rigs 'di byin gyis brlab par mdzod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rigs 'di byin gyis brlab par mdzod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, consecrate this lineage of yours.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /
translated: Then, immediately after the request,

original: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la bya'o //
translated: immediately after the request.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje chos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje chos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The vajra Dharma of all the Tathagatas is the essence of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i dam tshig ni hr'i: zhes bya ba thugs la gnas so //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni hr'i: zhes bya ba thugs la gnas so //
translated: Its pledge is the syllable HRĪḤ, which abides in the mind.

original: de las byung pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs la gnas pa'i sems dpa'i rdo rje gang las padma lta bur byung pa de skad du bshad pa des byin gyis brlabs shing brtan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de las byung pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs la gnas pa'i sems dpa'i rdo rje gang las padma lta bur byung pa de skad du bshad pa des byin gyis brlabs shing brtan par mdzad nas /
translated: From that, the vajra being who arises from the mind of Vairocana, who is born from the lotus, is consecrated and stabilized by that very explanation.

original: padmo lta bu la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa ming de skad ces bya ba de la snyoms par zhugs shing mngon sum du mdzad nas so //
analyzed: padmo lta bu la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa ming de skad ces bya ba de la snyoms par zhugs shing mngon sum du mdzad nas so //
translated: He enters into, and actualizes, the meditative absorption called by that very name, which has the lotus as its object.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: This means abiding in the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos ni padma'i 'od zer gyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos ni padma'i 'od zer gyi gzugs can no //
translated: The Dharma of all the Tathagatas is in the form of lotus light rays.

original: dam tshig ces bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: Commitment means cause.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ni rang gi thugs la gnas pa'i thugs ka'i sems dpa'i rdo rje las byung ba ni nges par byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ni rang gi thugs la gnas pa'i thugs ka'i sems dpa'i rdo rje las byung ba ni nges par byung ba'o //
translated: The heart of all the Tathagatas is the mind of enlightenment in one's heart. Arisen from the vajra means arisen from the vajra of the mind of enlightenment in one's heart.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: padma'i rigs sprul ba'i phyir dang padma'i rnam pa'i 'od zer las 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir sems dpa'i rdo rje byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis rnam par
analyzed: padma'i rigs sprul ba'i phyir dang padma'i rnam pa'i 'od zer las 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug tu byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir sems dpa'i rdo rje byin gyis brlabs pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis rnam par
translated: In order to emanate the lotus family and in order to consecrate the light rays in the form of lotuses as Avalokitesvara, the Blessed One, Vairochana, having concentrated his mind on the consecration of the vajra of the mind of enlightenment,

original: snang mdzad chen po la bskul bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: snang mdzad chen po la bskul bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: urged the Great Vairochana.🔽From the hearts of all the Tathagatas means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka nas zhas bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs ka nas zhas bya ba ni /
translated: from the hearts of all the Tathagatas.

original: bsdu bas byin nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i thugs las so //
analyzed: bsdu bas byin nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i thugs las so //
translated: The light rays are the light rays of the lotus.

original: padma lta bu ni padma'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: padma lta bu ni padma'i rnam par ro //
translated: The lotus is the lotus of the light rays.

original: kha dog du ma ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / dkar po'i kha dog go //
analyzed: kha dog du ma ni sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / dkar po'i kha dog go //
translated: The many colors are the colors of blue, yellow, red, green, and white.

original: gzugs du ma ni dbyi bas sna tshogs pa'o ;
analyzed: gzugs du ma ni dbyi bas sna tshogs pa'o ;
translated: The many forms are the various forms.

original: / rtags du ma ni mtshan ma sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: / rtags du ma ni mtshan ma sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The many signs are the various signs.

original: spyod lam du ma ni gnas pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'i rang bzhin gyi padma lta bu'i 'od zer byung nas /
analyzed: spyod lam du ma ni gnas pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'i rang bzhin gyi padma lta bu'i 'od zer byung nas /
translated: The many activities are the activities of standing, walking, sitting, and lying down.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽de la mi dmigs pa'i thugs @19a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni / de la mi dmigs pa'i thugs @19a * //
translated: The purification of attachment and so on is as follows.

original: rje chen po chags pa'o //
analyzed: rje chen po chags pa'o //
translated: The great compassion is the great compassion of non-apprehension.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa sngar bshad pa rnams gzung ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa sngar bshad pa rnams gzung ba'o //
translated: The and so on includes the previously explained bodhicitta and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang por byas pa gang yin pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang por byas pa gang yin pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The attachment and so on is the attachment and so on that begins with attachment.🔽 The purification is the purification of attachment and so on.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid kyi ye shes kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid kyi ye shes kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the purification of that, and because of the gnosis of reality, the afflictions such as passion are abandoned together with their traces.

original: der nges pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs kyis de rnams yang dag par sbyang zhing dag pa las 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i ye shes la sogs pa gdul bya la bskyed par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der nges pa'i ye shes kyi gzugs kyis de rnams yang dag par sbyang zhing dag pa las 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i ye shes la sogs pa gdul bya la bskyed par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the gnosis of Avalokiteśvara, which is purified and exalted from that, should be generated in the disciples by the form of the gnosis that is certain in that.

original: yang slar log ste 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i thugs kar zhugs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang slar log ste 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i thugs kar zhugs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Again, returning, it enters into the heart of the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: 'od zer zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer zhugs pa'o //
translated: This is the entry of the light ray.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'dis padma'i rigs sprul par byin gyis rlob pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'dis padma'i rigs sprul par byin gyis rlob pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that this noble Avalokiteśvara is empowered to emanate the lotus family.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, the pledge of the Dharma of all tathāgatas, etc.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang por byin gyis brlabs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang por byin gyis brlabs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la /
translated: Immediately after the consecration of the noble Avalokiteśvara,🔽the Blessed One Vairocana, with the non-dual mind and mental factors of all Tathāgatas,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i padma'i rigs kyi lha rnams so ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i padma'i rigs kyi lha rnams so ;
translated: the deities of the lotus family,

original: / de dag gi chos ni padma'i rigs kyi rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: / de dag gi chos ni padma'i rigs kyi rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: their Dharma is the maṇḍala of the lotus family, both the support and the supported.

original: de'i dam tshig ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Its commitment is the causal generation.

original: ming de skad ces bya ba gang yin pa de rig pa dam pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ming de skad ces bya ba gang yin pa de rig pa dam pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: That which is called by that name, he spoke this sublime knowledge.

original: de ltar phyag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje snying po dang / rdo rje spyan dang / rdo rje sna tshogs rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig gi rig padma pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar phyag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje snying po dang / rdo rje spyan dang / rdo rje sna tshogs rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig gi rig padma pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: Thus, Vajrapāṇi, Vajra Essence, Vajra Eye, and Vajra Variety, with this knowledge of the Dharma commitment of all Tathāgatas,🔽spoke this.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o //
translated: Then, immediately after that,

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po ni rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po ni rdo rje chos so //
translated: The noble Avalokitesvara is Vajradharma.

original: padma'i rigs sprul cing byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: padma'i rigs sprul cing byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he emanates and blesses the lotus family,

original: gzugs kyang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas na gzugs thams cad pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas na gzugs thams cad pa ste /
translated: he is the form of all forms.

original: padma'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'o //
translated: He is the lotus buddha, etc.

original: des 'dul pa'i rgyud la yang dag par ston pas na /
analyzed: des 'dul pa'i rgyud la yang dag par ston pas na /
translated: Because he teaches in the tantra that is to be tamed by him,

original: gzugs thams cad ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad ston pa'o //
translated: he is the teacher of all forms.

original: rgyu mtshan des ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni thugs la @19b gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan des ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni thugs la @19b gnas pa'o //
translated: For that reason, he is absorbed in that samadhi called by that name. This is the mental state.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dam tshig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dam tshig ces bya ba ni /
translated: The pledge of taming all migrators is

original: sems can gyi khams kyi 'gro ba thams cad 'dis 'dul bar byed pas 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi 'gro ba thams cad 'dis 'dul bar byed pas 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'o //
translated: the taming of all migrators in the realm of sentient beings by this.

original: padma'i rigs de'i dam tshig gi rgyur gyur pa ste skyed par byed pa'i snying po ni sgra'i gzugs te /
analyzed: padma'i rigs de'i dam tshig gi rgyur gyur pa ste skyed par byed pa'i snying po ni sgra'i gzugs te /
translated: It is the essence of the pledge of the lotus family, the cause of its generation, the form of sound.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dam tshig ces bya ba 'di gsungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dam tshig ces bya ba 'di gsungs shig pa'o //
translated: The pledge called taming all migrating beings.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i thugs las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i thugs las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the heart of the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'phags shing ring du song bas na 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'phags shing ring du song bas na 'phags pa'o //
translated: The noble one is the one who is noble, who has gone far, who has gone beyond all conceptual thoughts of object and subject.

original: sems can gyi khams rnams 'dul bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / rang gi rigs la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnams 'dul bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / rang gi rigs la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
translated: The one who tames the realms of sentient beings, who looks at his own family, is Avalokiteśvara.

original: de la dbang po ni mnga' bdag ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po ni mnga' bdag ste /
translated: The lord is the master.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: de'i thugs la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i thugs la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From his heart.

original: snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje padma'i 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi thugs de las so //
analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje padma'i 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi thugs de las so //
translated: From the heart of the noble Avalokiteśvara, who is on the vajra lotus located in the moon mandala in the heart.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas pa'i sems dpa' rdo rje'i gzugs ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas pa'i sems dpa' rdo rje'i gzugs ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, is the form of the Vajra Being abiding in the mind of all the Tathagatas, who is the Great Vajradhara.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The form of the Noble Avalokitesvara is

original: sangs rgyas padmo nas brtsams nas padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa de'i nang nas gang la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa de ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas padmo nas brtsams nas padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa de'i nang nas gang la 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa de ni 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: from the Buddha Padma up to Padma-kesara. Among them, the one who holds the form of the Noble Avalokitesvara is the one who holds the form of the Noble Avalokitesvara.

original: padma'i gdan la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhugs pas na padma la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i gdan la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bzhugs pas na padma la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Since he sits on a lotus seat on a moon disc, he is the one who sits on a lotus.

original: rdo rje rtse lnga pa la sogs pa nas dril bu'i mthar thug pa padmas mtshan pa'i mtshan ma'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa la sogs pa nas dril bu'i mthar thug pa padmas mtshan pa'i mtshan ma'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa'i phyir na /
translated: From the five-pronged vajra up to the bell, he holds the mudra of the sign marked with a lotus.

original: phyag rgya'i mtshan ma padma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i mtshan ma padma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who holds the sign of the lotus mudra.

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The various colors are blue, yellow, and so on.

original: gzugs ni dbyibs ring ba dang thung ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: gzugs ni dbyibs ring ba dang thung ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The forms are the shapes, long, short, and so on.

original: / cha lugs ni sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i bar ni cha byad do //
analyzed: / cha lugs ni sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i bar ni cha byad do //
translated: The costumes are the garments of the Buddhas, Padmanartaka, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi rgyan ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyan ni btags pa'o //
translated: The ornaments are the adornments.

original: kha dog dang gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rgyan sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyi cha byad dang rgyan no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la @20a * //
analyzed: kha dog dang gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rgyan sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyi cha byad dang rgyan no // de bzhin gshegs pa la @20a * //
translated: The various colors, forms, costumes, and ornaments are the various forms, costumes, and ornaments.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa'o //🔽sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa'o // sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Tathāgatas, and so on, are the Buddhas, Padmanartaka, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The forms of all the Bodhisattvas are the forms of all the Tathāgatas, and so on, the Bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lus su gyur nas byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lus su gyur nas byung ste /
translated: Having become such a great Bodhisattva, he appears.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams la 'khod nas ched du brjod pa ni ched du brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams la 'khod nas ched du brjod pa ni ched du brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Having arranged themselves in the lunar mandala, they uttered this meaningful expression.

original: ci zhig byas nas ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod ce na /
translated: What did they do that they uttered this meaningful expression?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “in all world-realms.”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par gnas pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag la gang dang gang gi gzugs kyis 'dul bar gyur pa de dang de'i gzugs kyis de dag rang gi gzugs su bstan nas 'dul bar byas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par gnas pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag la gang dang gang gi gzugs kyis 'dul bar gyur pa de dang de'i gzugs kyis de dag rang gi gzugs su bstan nas 'dul bar byas te /
translated: They manifested their own forms to those sentient beings who are situated in all world-realms, and they disciplined them in whatever forms were necessary to discipline them.

original: slar log nas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyogs dang mtshams su de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams la 'khod de padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'dug nas ched du brjod pa gsungs so //
analyzed: slar log nas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyogs dang mtshams su de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang / sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams la 'khod de padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'dug nas ched du brjod pa gsungs so //
translated: Having returned, he is seated on a lotus and moon disk in the manner of the great mandala of the Vajra Realm, in the form of all the heroes such as the Tathagata, etc.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Amazing means wondrous.

original: skal pa ji lta ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skal pa ji lta ba'i sems can 'dul ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to tame beings according to their fortune,

original: sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa'i gzugs bstan pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thabs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas padma la sogs pa'i gzugs bstan pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thabs so //
translated: the display of the forms of the Buddhas, lotuses, etc. is the method of all the Buddhas.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid ni dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid ni dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of compassion is the nature of non-referential compassion.

original: 'dir ci zhig ngo mtshar zhe na /🔽gang du thabs kyis 'dul mdzad na //
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig ngo mtshar zhe na / gang du thabs kyis 'dul mdzad na //
translated: What is amazing here?

original: zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: It is said, Where is the method of taming?

original: dmigs pa'i thugs rje la gnas nas lha rnams su yang gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i thugs rje la gnas nas lha rnams su yang gyur pa yin no //
translated: Having remained in the compassion of the object, he also became the gods.

original: 'khor ba'i phung po thams cad las bzlog nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phung po thams cad las bzlog nas /
translated: Having turned away from all the aggregates of cyclic existence,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs su zin kyang lha chen po la sogs pa lha'i gzugs su yang 'gyur pa 'di ni ngo mtshar ba'o//
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs su zin kyang lha chen po la sogs pa lha'i gzugs su yang 'gyur pa 'di ni ngo mtshar ba'o//
translated: even though he has abandoned karma and afflictions together with their imprints, he also became the forms of the gods, such as Maheśvara. This is amazing!

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi sku ma yin yang lha la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba la mos pa rnams kyis mthong ba yin no //🔽de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni gzugs kyi sku ma yin yang lha la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba la mos pa rnams kyis mthong ba yin no // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas /
translated: Even though the Tathāgata, whose nature is the dharmadhātu, is not a form body, those who are devoted to the taming of the gods and so on see him in the form of the gods and so on.

original: lha rnams su yang gyur pa @20b yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung 'di tsam gyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams su yang gyur pa @20b yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung 'di tsam gyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Then, with just this text, “Then all the tathāgatas…” up to “…he also became the gods,” two samādhis are taught, called the maṇḍala of the great maṇḍala of taming migrating beings and the supreme king of maṇḍalas.

original: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the gathering in, the consecration, and so forth, should be known as the third samadhi called the King of Actions Supreme.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por dam tshig dang dbang bskur bas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po las gsungs pa'i dngos grub rnams ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por dam tshig dang dbang bskur bas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the powers taught in the Great Mandala of Subjugation of the Three Worlds are to be accomplished by means of the commitments and consecrations in the Great Mandala of Subjugation of the Three Worlds,

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yin no //
translated: [the Bhagavat] declares, “Then the Bhagavat,” and so forth. This is the extensive ritual for the master’s actions and the disciple’s entrance.

original: rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to emanate the mandala of his own lineage,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul nas /
translated: he offers it to all the Tathagatas,

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'di bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and he explains this Great Mandala of Subjugation of the Three Worlds.

original: sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa dgos pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa dgos pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the statement, “all sentient beings,” and so forth?

original: sems can thams cad la ngan song du ltung ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas mi 'jigs pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la ngan song du ltung ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas mi 'jigs pa ni /
translated: They are fearless with regard to all sentient beings, in that they are not afraid of their falling into the lower realms, dying and so on.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang don thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang don thob pa'o //
translated: The gift of fearlessness to all sentient beings is the attainment of the goal.

original: dngos grub dam pa ni de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub dam pa ni de sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' grub pa'o //
translated: The highest power is the power of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: rdo rje chos nyid ni padma'i rigs rdo rje gsang ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje chos nyid ni padma'i rigs rdo rje gsang ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the Vajra Dharma is the nature of the secret of the Lotus Family.

original: de'i ye shes ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni nges pa'o //
translated: Its intuition is certainty.

original: mngon par shes pa ni drug go //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni drug go //
translated: The superknowledges are the six.

original: sems can de thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / don dang dngos grub dam pa dang / rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu rnyed ba'i rgyu de'i phyir phul lo //
analyzed: sems can de thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / don dang dngos grub dam pa dang / rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu rnyed ba'i rgyu de'i phyir phul lo //
translated: The gift of fearlessness to all sentient beings, the attainment of the goal, the highest power, the nature of the Vajra Dharma, intuition, and the attainment of the fruit of the superknowledges—for that reason, it is the best.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: “This” is the one who is established in the mind.

analyzed: sems dpa' chen po snyoms par zhugs par bri'o //

original: gang du zhe na /

analyzed: sogs zhes bya ba de ni snga ma bzhin no //

translated: say “oṃ hūṃ hriḥ hoḥ” and enter into the Bhagavān, and meditate on yourself as inseparable with him.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar gyi phyag rgya chen po bcings la yid kyis rang gi lus kyi gnas su 'dug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar gyi phyag rgya chen po bcings la yid kyis rang gi lus kyi gnas su 'dug ste /
translated: Similarly, having bound the great seal of each one up to Vajra Acala, mentally place them in the places of your body.

original: rang gi lus las phyi rol gyi mdun du padma 'bebs pa'i yi ge aa'i mtha' can gyi sngags kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du padma'i dril bu bskyed la padmo ghanta aa ham /
analyzed: rang gi lus las phyi rol gyi mdun du padma 'bebs pa'i yi ge aa'i mtha' can gyi sngags kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du padma'i dril bu bskyed la padmo ghanta aa ham /
translated: From your body, outside in front, on a moon maṇḍala generated by the mantra ending with “āḥ,” generate a lotus-handled bell, and say “padmo ghaṇṭā aham.”

original: zhes padma'i dril bu'i nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: zhes padma'i dril bu'i nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: This is the pride of the lotus-handled bell.

original: padma a'a be sha aa ham /
analyzed: padma a'a be sha aa ham /
translated: “Padma āveśa aham”

original: zhes bya ba des padma 'bebs pa'i gzugs su bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba des padma 'bebs pa'i gzugs su bsgoms la /
translated: is the meditation on the form of Padma Acala.

original: de nas padma 'bebs pa de nyid la rta mgrin la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcings ba dang dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de nas padma 'bebs pa de nyid la rta mgrin la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyis dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcings ba dang dbang du byas te /
translated: Then, with that very Padmanartteśvara, the action seal of Hayagrīva and so forth, one should summon, induct, bind, and control.

original: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bltas la /
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bltas la /
translated: Looking with one's pledge seal,

original: de'i sngags brjod cing dri shya zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: de'i sngags brjod cing dri shya zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: one should recite the mantra of that [seal] and say dis.

original: de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya de nyid dang / dza:h'um bam ho: zhes brjod pas rang gi lus la bcug la /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi phyag rgya de nyid dang / dza:h'um bam ho: zhes brjod pas rang gi lus la bcug la /
translated: Then, with that very pledge seal, saying jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, one should enter into one's own body.

original: sa ma ya stvam zhes bya bas 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dbab pa dang / sa ma ya stvam aa ham /
analyzed: sa ma ya stvam zhes bya bas 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dbab pa dang / sa ma ya stvam aa ham /
translated: With samaya stvaṃ, one should imagine the descent of the mandala of light, and with samaya stvaṃ aham,

original: zhes pa dang sngags brjod pas padma 'bebs pa dang ; bdag nyid lhan cig tu gyur par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dang sngags brjod pas padma 'bebs pa dang ; bdag nyid lhan cig tu gyur par bsam par bya'o //
translated: saying the mantra, one should imagine Padmanartteśvara and oneself becoming one.

original: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa'i rten dang / brten pa'i lus la rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dza:h'um bam ho: zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa'i rten dang / brten pa'i lus la rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dza:h'um bam ho: zhes brjod cing /
translated: Then, with regard to the bodies of the supports and the supported, such as the taming of migrators, and so on, all the tathagatas, such as Vairocana and Akobhya, are invited with the words jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ.

original: yid kyis legs pa'i sbyor ba yis /
analyzed: yid kyis legs pa'i sbyor ba yis /
translated: With the proper mental application,

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis gzhug cing bsgrub par bya'o //🔽de nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis gzhug cing bsgrub par bya'o // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: they are caused to enter and be accomplished with the pledge seals.🔽Then, the tathagatas and so on, up to and including Padmanarteshvara, are sealed with the dharma, karma, and great pledge seals.🔽The tathagatas are empowered with the Vajradhatviśvarī mudra, the Vajrasattva, Ratna, Dharma, and Karma mudras, and so on.

original: padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du chos dang / las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis rgyas btab la rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i phyag rgya dang rdo rje sems ma dang / rin @27b chen dang / chos dang / rdo rje las ma'i phyag rgya rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byin gyis brlab pa dang /🔽'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du chos dang / las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis rgyas btab la rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i phyag rgya dang rdo rje sems ma dang / rin @27b chen dang / chos dang / rdo rje las ma'i phyag rgya rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byin gyis brlab pa dang /🔽'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The taming of migrators and so on, up to and including Padmanarteshvara, are empowered with the Vajradhatviśvarī mudra, the Vajrasattva, Ratna, Dharma, and Karma mudras, and so on.

original: padma 'bebs pa'i bar du rdo rje padma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas rang gi lus kyi snying ga dang / dpral ba dang / lkog ma dang / spyi bor rim pa bzhin du byin gyis brlabs te /🔽snying ga'i padma'i phyogs rnams su rdo rje padma sangs rgyas kyis dbang bskur ba dpral pa'i phyogs rnams kyi rdo rje rin chen ma'i gnas su bshad zin pa'i rin po che padma'o //
analyzed: padma 'bebs pa'i bar du rdo rje padma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas rang gi lus kyi snying ga dang / dpral ba dang / lkog ma dang / spyi bor rim pa bzhin du byin gyis brlabs te / snying ga'i padma'i phyogs rnams su rdo rje padma sangs rgyas kyis dbang bskur ba dpral pa'i phyogs rnams kyi rdo rje rin chen ma'i gnas su bshad zin pa'i rin po che padma'o //
translated: Up to Padma-avatara, one should bless one's body with the pledge seal of Vajra-padma, at the heart, forehead, throat, and crown, respectively.

original: lkog ma'i phyogs rnams kyi rdo rje chos ma'i gnas su bshad zin pa'i padmo'i rdo rje padma'o //
analyzed: lkog ma'i phyogs rnams kyi rdo rje chos ma'i gnas su bshad zin pa'i padmo'i rdo rje padma'o //
translated: In the directions of the heart lotus, one should generate the consecration of the Buddhas of the Vajra-padma family, the jewel lotus as explained in the abode of Vajra-ratna in the directions of the forehead, the vajra lotus as explained in the abode of Vajra-dharma in the directions of the throat, and the lotus vajra as explained in the abode of Vajra-karma in the directions of the crown.

original: thams cad kyi spyi bo'i phyogs kyi rdo rje las ma'i gnas su bshad zin pa'i sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i gdan rnams la sna tshogs padma re re zhing rim gyis bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi spyi bo'i phyogs kyi rdo rje las ma'i gnas su bshad zin pa'i sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i gdan rnams la sna tshogs padma re re zhing rim gyis bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In the abode of Vajra-karma in the directions of the crown of all, one should generate the various lotuses and moon seats as explained, and the various lotuses, one by one, in order.

original: de nas rdo rje dbyings las bshad pa'i rdo rje rin chen gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbang bskur la 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa nas /🔽padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dbyings las bshad pa'i rdo rje rin chen gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbang bskur la 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa nas / padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du /
translated: Then, empower the tathāgatas with the pledge seal of the vajra jewel as explained in the Vajra Realm Tantra, and from the taming of migrators up to the descent of the lotus,

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i rdo rje chos ma'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i rdo rje chos ma'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: empower with the vajra Dharma seal as explained in the Dhāraṇī of Taming Migrators Mandala.

original: de nas rdo rje padma'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba dang / bdag po'i dbang bskur ba dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi padma'i brtul zhugs blangs la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje padma'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba dang / bdag po'i dbang bskur ba dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi padma'i brtul zhugs blangs la /
translated: Then, empower with the vajra lotus seal, the empowerment of the lord, the empowerment of the name, and take up the spiritual practice of the lotus of spiritual powers.

original: padma'i sgeg mo la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: padma'i sgeg mo la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang / padma'i rigs kyi las kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i mchod pa bcu drug gis yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Then, worship with the lotus grace and so forth, and with the sixteen offerings explained in the Lotus Karma Mandala.

original: de nyid kyis na padma gzung//
analyzed: de nyid kyis na padma gzung//
translated: Then, hold up the lotus,

original: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya //
analyzed: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya //
translated: and ring the Dharma bell.

original: dam tshig gi ni phyag rgya cha //
analyzed: dam tshig gi ni phyag rgya cha //
translated: The pledge seal is the part.

original: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
translated: Having blessed, one should recite the essence.

original: de nas aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de nas aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Then, one should say OṂ Vajra ĀTMAKO ’HAṂ.

original: zhes brjod pas lha thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas lha thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By this, one should meditate oneself as the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the deities.

original: aom sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
translated: With OṂ SVABHĀVA ŚUDDHÔ HAM,

original: zhes bya bas gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mos pa dang / aom sarba sa mo ham zhes bya bas bdag gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mos pa dang / aom sarba sa mo ham zhes bya bas bdag gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su bskyed par bya'o //
translated: one should imagine the nature of emptiness, which is like a reflection, and with OṂ SARVA SAMÔHAṂ, one should generate the nondual wisdom of oneself.

original: lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid bdag yin no snyam du bsams la 'di tsam gyis ni rnal 'byor chen po rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid bdag yin no snyam du bsams la 'di tsam gyis ni rnal 'byor chen po rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thinking “I am the essence of all the deities,” one should imagine this much.

original: da ni @28a * //
analyzed: da ni @28a * //
translated: Now,

original: gnas kyi nges pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi nges pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: the ascertainment of the place should be stated.

original: de la sngags pa'i snying gar gnas pa'i zla ba la zla ba dang padma'i gdan gyi dbus su 'gro ba 'dul ba'i mdun du padma'i sangs rgyas /🔽g-yas su padma'i rgyal po /
analyzed: de la sngags pa'i snying gar gnas pa'i zla ba la zla ba dang padma'i gdan gyi dbus su 'gro ba 'dul ba'i mdun du padma'i sangs rgyas / g-yas su padma'i rgyal po /
translated: In front of him is Padma Buddha,🔽to the right is Padma Rāja,

original: g-yon du padma'i chags pa /
analyzed: g-yon du padma'i chags pa /
translated: to the left is Padma Rāga,

original: rgyab tu padma'i legs pa /
analyzed: rgyab tu padma'i legs pa /
translated: and behind is Padma Sādhu.

original: mdzod spu'i phyogs su gtsug phud sangs rgyas dang / padma'i khro gnyer rig pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: mdzod spu'i phyogs su gtsug phud sangs rgyas dang / padma'i khro gnyer rig pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: In the direction of the ūrṇā is Śikhī Buddha and Padma Bhrukuṭi Jñānarāja.

original: mgo bo'i rgyab tu padma'i nyi ma /🔽phrag pa gnyis su padma'i dpal /
analyzed: mgo bo'i rgyab tu padma'i nyi ma / phrag pa gnyis su padma'i dpal /
translated: On the back of the head is Padma Sūrya.🔽On the two shoulders is Padma Śrī.

original: so'i phreng ba gnyis la padma'i bzhad pa /
analyzed: so'i phreng ba gnyis la padma'i bzhad pa /
translated: On the two rows of teeth is Padma Hāsa.

original: lkog ma'i phyogs su dbus kyi cha la padma'i ting nge 'dzin /
analyzed: lkog ma'i phyogs su dbus kyi cha la padma'i ting nge 'dzin /
translated: In the direction of the throat, in the center, is Padma Samādhi.

original: de'i mdun du padma'i sgrol ma /
analyzed: de'i mdun du padma'i sgrol ma /
translated: In front of him is Padma Tārā.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i nu ma gnyis la padma rnon po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i nu ma gnyis la padma rnon po'o //
translated: On the two breasts of the yoginī is Padma Tīkṣṇa.

original: lte bar padma'i rgyu /
analyzed: lte bar padma'i rgyu /
translated: At the navel is Padma Nāda.

original: lce la padma'i bsrung ba /
analyzed: lce la padma'i bsrung ba /
translated: On the tongue is Padma Rakṣa.

original: spyi gtsug tu padma don yod pa'i dbang phyug / de'i mdun du padma gar gyi dbang phyug / rnal 'byor pa'i nam 'tshang gnyis su padma'i bsrung ba /
analyzed: spyi gtsug tu padma don yod pa'i dbang phyug / de'i mdun du padma gar gyi dbang phyug / rnal 'byor pa'i nam 'tshang gnyis su padma'i bsrung ba /
translated: On the crown of the head is Padma Amoghasiddhi,🔽in front of him is Padma Narteshvara,

original: khar padma'i gnod spyin /
analyzed: khar padma'i gnod spyin /
translated: and on the two shoulders of the yogi is Padma Raksha.🔽In the mouth is Padma Vetali.

original: rked par padma'i khu tshur /
analyzed: rked par padma'i khu tshur /
translated: At the waist is Padma Mukti.

original: sangs rgyas padma'i g-yon logs su padma'i sgeg mo dang / padma'i khro gnyer /
analyzed: sangs rgyas padma'i g-yon logs su padma'i sgeg mo dang / padma'i khro gnyer /
translated: To the left of Buddha Padma is Padma Lalita and Padma Bhasme.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i g-yon logs su padma'i phreng ba ma /🔽padma sgrol ma'i g-yon logs su padma'i glu ma /
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i g-yon logs su padma'i phreng ba ma / padma sgrol ma'i g-yon logs su padma'i glu ma /
translated: To the left of Vidyaraja is Padma Mala.🔽To the left of Padma Tara is Padma Gita.

original: padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi g-yon logs su padma'i gar ma /
analyzed: padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi g-yon logs su padma'i gar ma /
translated: To the left of Padma Narteshvara is Padma Nrtya.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i snam logs kyi gsang ba'i gnas su padma'i bdug pa ma /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i snam logs kyi gsang ba'i gnas su padma'i bdug pa ma /
translated: To the back of the yogi, in the secret place, is Padma Dhupika.

original: mgo la padma'i me tog ma /
analyzed: mgo la padma'i me tog ma /
translated: On the head is Padma Pushpe.

original: mig la padma'i mar me ma /
analyzed: mig la padma'i mar me ma /
translated: In the eyes is Padma Aloke.

original: nu ma dang brang dang / snying gar padma'i byug pa ma /🔽brla g-yas pa la rta mgrin /
analyzed: nu ma dang brang dang / snying gar padma'i byug pa ma / brla g-yas pa la rta mgrin /
translated: On the breasts and heart is Padma Gandhe.🔽On the right thigh is Hayagriva.

original: brla g-yon pa la don yod pa'i zhags pa /
analyzed: brla g-yon pa la don yod pa'i zhags pa /
translated: On the left thigh is Amoghapasa.

original: byin pa g-yas pa la padma'i lcags sgrog / byin pa g-yon pa la padma'i 'bebs pa /
analyzed: byin pa g-yas pa la padma'i lcags sgrog / byin pa g-yon pa la padma'i 'bebs pa /
translated: The right foot is the lotus hook, the left foot is the lotus noose, the right knee is the lotus chain, and the left knee is the lotus downward-facing spear.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rten dang brten pa'i lus kyi yan lag thams cad la til dang til mar gyi tshul gyis bzhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rten dang brten pa'i lus kyi yan lag thams cad la til dang til mar gyi tshul gyis bzhugs so //
translated: The tathāgatas reside in all the limbs of the body, which is the support and the supported, in the manner of sesame seeds and sesame oil.

original: nyin re zhing rnal 'byor chen po lan re bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin re zhing rnal 'byor chen po lan re bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should perform the great yoga once a day.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor chen po byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor chen po byas nas /
translated: Having performed the great yoga in that way,

original: thun bzhi'i sbyor bas thams cad kyi sngags bzlas brjod 'bum bya ba'am /
analyzed: thun bzhi'i sbyor bas thams cad kyi sngags bzlas brjod 'bum bya ba'am /
translated: one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times in four sessions,

original: yang na rang gi snying gar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor sprul la zla ba gcig gam /
analyzed: yang na rang gi snying gar 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor sprul la zla ba gcig gam /
translated: or else, in one’s heart, one should emanate the maṇḍala as explained in the maṇḍala of the four seals of taming migrating beings, which will be explained, and meditate for one month,

original: zla ba drug drug gam /
analyzed: zla ba drug drug gam /
translated: or six months,

original: lo gcig gi bar du ji srid rgyun mi 'chad par @28b dkyil 'khor mngon sum du mthong ba de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lo gcig gi bar du ji srid rgyun mi 'chad par @28b dkyil 'khor mngon sum du mthong ba de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: or one year, for as long as one continuously sees the maṇḍala in actuality.

original: yang na dang por sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor chen po rgyal mchog dang / las kyi rgyal mchog bsgoms la /
analyzed: yang na dang por sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor chen po rgyal mchog dang / las kyi rgyal mchog bsgoms la /
translated: Alternatively, one should first cultivate the yoga of the preparatory rite, the supreme victor of the great maṇḍala, and the supreme victor of the rite.

original: nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor ba zla ba gcig gam /
analyzed: nyin re zhing thun bzhi'i sbyor ba zla ba gcig gam /
translated: One should cultivate the maṇḍala for one month,

original: zla ba drug gam /
analyzed: zla ba drug gam /
translated: six months,

original: lo gcig gi bar du dkyil 'khor bsgom bar bya'o //
analyzed: lo gcig gi bar du dkyil 'khor bsgom bar bya'o //
translated: or one year, in four sessions each day.

original: de ltar snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor chen po bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de ltar snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor chen po bsgoms nas /
translated: Having thus cultivated the great yoga as before,

original: sa sbyang ba dang / sa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa sbyang ba dang / sa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: one should purify the ground and take possession of the ground.

original: de nas bdag nyid khrus byas la lus dris byugs /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid khrus byas la lus dris byugs /
translated: Then, having bathed oneself, one should anoint one’s body with perfume,

original: ji snyed pa'i rgyan gdags shing /
analyzed: ji snyed pa'i rgyan gdags shing /
translated: wear as many ornaments as one has,

original: shin tu dkar ba'i gos bsgo zhing /
analyzed: shin tu dkar ba'i gos bsgo zhing /
translated: and put on very white clothes.

original: me tog phreng bas gdong yang brgyan /🔽zhag bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gsum nas brtsams te /
analyzed: me tog phreng bas gdong yang brgyan / zhag bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gsum nas brtsams te /
translated: One should also adorn one’s face with a flower garland.

original: dkyil 'khor bsgoms nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bsgoms nas /
translated: For seven days, one should cultivate the maṇḍala, beginning with the three meditative concentrations.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su bdag dang gnas bsrung ba byas la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su bdag dang gnas bsrung ba byas la /
translated: Then, in the center of the maṇḍala ground, one should protect oneself and the place.

original: sngar bshad pa'i padma'i rgyu'i las kyi phyag rgyas dkyil 'khor sprul te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i padma'i rgyu'i las kyi phyag rgyas dkyil 'khor sprul te /
translated: One should emanate the maṇḍala with the action seal of the lotus cause, as previously explained.
