translated: Then, with the mantra Oṃ vajra puṣpe hūṃ, and so forth, one should recite the mantra three times.

original: de la rdo rje rtse mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje rtse mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra and mudrā of the vajra peak, and so forth, are as follows:

original: aom badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta /
analyzed: aom badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta /
translated: Oṃ vajra śikhara rutamāta.

original: rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags so //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of the vajra peak.

original: aom badzra dzva la aa na la ha na da ha pa tsa ma tha bhanydza ra na h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra dzva la aa na la ha na da ha pa tsa ma tha bhanydza ra na h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra jvālānaladhāpakamacchatabhñjarana hūṃ phaṭ.

original: rdo rje me'i sngags so //
analyzed: rdo rje me'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of the vajra fire.

original: badzra pushpe h'um zhes bya ba me tog gi sngags so //🔽aom badzra gandhe zhes bya ba dri'i sngags so //
analyzed: badzra pushpe h'um zhes bya ba me tog gi sngags so // aom badzra gandhe zhes bya ba dri'i sngags so //
translated: Vajra puṣpe hūṃ is the mantra of flowers.🔽Oṃ vajra gandhe is the mantra of incense.

original: aom badzra dh'u pe h'um zhes bya ba bdug pa'i sngags so //🔽aa k'a ro mu kham sarbba dharmma nam /🔽a'adya nutpnna tv'a ta ces pa lha bshos kyi sngags so //
analyzed: aom badzra dh'u pe h'um zhes bya ba bdug pa'i sngags so // aa k'a ro mu kham sarbba dharmma nam / a'adya nutpnna tv'a ta ces pa lha bshos kyi sngags so //
translated: Oṃ vajra dhūpe hūṃ is the mantra of incense.🔽Aka ro mukham sarva dharmāṇām / adhyātma utpattitvāt is the mantra of food offerings.

original: aom badzra a'a lo ke zhes bya ba mar me'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom badzra a'a lo ke zhes bya ba mar me'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ vajra āloke is the mantra of lamps.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du byed pa ni rdo rje rtse mo'i'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du byed pa ni rdo rje rtse mo'i'o //
translated: The two vajra fists are in the manner of lifting a mountain; this is the mudra of Vajra Peak.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la sor mo 'bar ba lta bu las mthe bo gnyis rdo rjer bsgreng ba ni rdo rje khro bo ti r'anti ri'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba 'di rdo rje me'i phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la sor mo 'bar ba lta bu las mthe bo gnyis rdo rjer bsgreng ba ni rdo rje khro bo ti r'anti ri'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba 'di rdo rje me'i phyag rgya yin no //
translated: The vajra fist is bound inward, the fingers blazing, and the two thumbs erect like a vajra; this is called the mudra of Vajra Wrath Tirantadhara.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la gyen du 'thor ba'i tshul du byed pa ni me tog gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la gyen du 'thor ba'i tshul du byed pa ni me tog gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two vajra fists are bound and thrown upward in the manner of scattering; this is the mudra of flowers.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la dris byug pa'i tshul du byed pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la dris byug pa'i tshul du byed pa ni /
translated: The two vajra fists are bound and applied in the manner of anointing with perfume;

original: dri'i phyag rgya'o //🔽rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis bdug pa 'thul ba'i tshul du byed pa ni bdug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dri'i phyag rgya'o // rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis bdug pa 'thul ba'i tshul du byed pa ni bdug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: this is the mudra of perfume.🔽The two vajra fists emit incense in the manner of burning incense; this is the mudra of incense.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis ral gri 'debs pa'i tshul du byed pa ni lha bshos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis ral gri 'debs pa'i tshul du byed pa ni lha bshos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two vajra fists strike like a sword; this is the mudra of food.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la mthe bo gnyis gshibs te bsgreng nas mar me'i sdong bu ltar byed pa ni mar me'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la mthe bo gnyis gshibs te bsgreng nas mar me'i sdong bu ltar byed pa ni mar me'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Having formed the two vajra fists, one should erect the two thumbs side by side like the wick of a lamp; this is the lamp gesture.

original: aom h'um hr'i:ho: zhes bya ba me tog gi rdo rje thal mo bcings la /
analyzed: aom h'um hr'i:ho: zhes bya ba me tog gi rdo rje thal mo bcings la /
translated: Om hum hri: ho! Having formed the flower vajra palms,

original: mthe bo gnyis brkyang ste thal mo 'byed pa'i tshul gyis yon chab la sngags lan bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bzlas la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mthe bo gnyis brkyang ste thal mo 'byed pa'i tshul gyis yon chab la sngags lan bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bzlas la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: one should extend the two thumbs and, in the manner of opening the palms, recite the mantra seven or twenty-one times over the water offering and place it.

original: @30b de nas dkyil 'khor gyi gnas thams cad rdo rje rtse mo yongs su bzlas pa'i dri chu dang / padma'i gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i chus byugs la /
analyzed: @30b de nas dkyil 'khor gyi gnas thams cad rdo rje rtse mo yongs su bzlas pa'i dri chu dang / padma'i gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i chus byugs la /
translated: Then, having anointed the entire site of the maṇḍala with water infused with the perfume of the completely-recited vajra-peak and the perfume of the completely-recited lotus yakṣa,

original: de nyid yongs su bzlas pa'i dri'i chus lha rnams kyi gnas su dkyil 'khor bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid yongs su bzlas pa'i dri'i chus lha rnams kyi gnas su dkyil 'khor bya'o //
translated: one should draw the maṇḍala in the place of the deities with water infused with the perfume of the completely-recited [mantra].

original: da nas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi gnas rnams su yid kyis bzhag la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sngags lan bdun bzlas te /
analyzed: da nas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi gnas rnams su yid kyis bzhag la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sngags lan bdun bzlas te /
translated: Now, having mentally placed all the sites of the maṇḍala, one should recite the mantras of Vairocana and so forth seven times.

original: dri'i dkyil 'khor rnams la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa nam mkha'i phyogs nas phab ste /
analyzed: dri'i dkyil 'khor rnams la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i mthar thug pa nam mkha'i phyogs nas phab ste /
translated: The maṇḍalas of scent are placed from the direction of space, beginning with Vairocana and ending with Padma-netra.

original: rang rang gi sngags kyis gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi sngags kyis gzhag par bya'o //
translated: They should be placed with their respective mantras.

original: bskal pa bzang po pa rnams kyang rang gi gnas rnams su /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po pa rnams kyang rang gi gnas rnams su /
translated: The good eons are placed in their own places.

original: aom sarbba sam ska ra pa ri shuddha dharmma te ga ga na sa mung+ga te /
analyzed: aom sarbba sam ska ra pa ri shuddha dharmma te ga ga na sa mung+ga te /
translated: Oṃ sarva-saṃskāra-pariśuddha-dharmatā-gata gaganasaṃmūgata

original: ma h'a na ya pa ri b'a re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ma h'a na ya pa ri b'a re sv'a h'a /
translated: mahānaya-parivāra svāhā.

original: zhes bya bas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: They should be placed with this mantra.

original: de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum par dri'i chu cung zad cig blugs la /
analyzed: de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum par dri'i chu cung zad cig blugs la /
translated: Then, having poured a little scented water into the victorious vase,

original: rdo rje me dang / padma'i gnod sbyin dang / 'gro ba 'dul ba'i sngags re re zhing brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la lha'i rang bzhin du de bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rdo rje me dang / padma'i gnod sbyin dang / 'gro ba 'dul ba'i sngags re re zhing brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la lha'i rang bzhin du de bsgoms nas /
translated: one should recite the mantra of Vajra-fire, the mantra of Lotus-yakṣa, and the mantra of Conqueror-of-the-world each 108 times, and meditate on them as having the nature of the deities.

original: mchod yon gyi sngags dang re re zhing mchod yon phul la /
analyzed: mchod yon gyi sngags dang re re zhing mchod yon phul la /
translated: Having offered a libation with the mantra of the libation for each one,

original: mchod pa thams cad phyag rgya dang bcas pas yang dag par mchod la rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas me tog gi lcug ma bzung ste /
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad phyag rgya dang bcas pas yang dag par mchod la rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas me tog gi lcug ma bzung ste /
translated: Having made offerings to all of them with the seals, one should hold a spray of flowers with one's pledge seal.

original: re re zhing sngags brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas la /
analyzed: re re zhing sngags brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas la /
translated: Reciting the mantra eight hundred times for each,

original: yang bdug pas bdugs la nyin zhag gnyis pa la de bzhin du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang bdug pas bdugs la nyin zhag gnyis pa la de bzhin du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: one should again fumigate them with incense. On the second day, one should recite [the mantra] in the same way.

original: bum pa de yang lhag par gnas pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba'i spyan sngar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa de yang lhag par gnas pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba'i spyan sngar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: That vase, which has been empowered, should be placed in front of the Blessed One, the Tamer of Beings.

original: lhag par gnas pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas su spyad la de nas nyi ma 'char ka'i dus su rdo rje slong ba'i phyag rgya de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor nam mkhar bzhag la thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas su spyad la de nas nyi ma 'char ka'i dus su rdo rje slong ba'i phyag rgya de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor nam mkhar bzhag la thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having used the articles as they are in all the empowerments, then at dawn one should place the mandala in the sky with that very mudra of summoning the vajra, and one should lay out the lines.

original: de la dang por re zhig tshon rtsi sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / dkar po dri zhim pa bsgos la /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig tshon rtsi sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / dkar po dri zhim pa bsgos la /
translated: There, first of all, one should dye the colors blue, yellow, red, green, and white with fragrant substances.

original: srad bu so sor kha bsgyur la go rims 'di nyid kyis bzhag ste /
analyzed: srad bu so sor kha bsgyur la go rims 'di nyid kyis bzhag ste /
translated: Having dyed the individual threads, one should arrange them in this order.

original: h'um hr'am hr'i:aa aom zhes bya ba'i sa bon gyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa srad bu de rnams la bkod de /
analyzed: h'um hr'am hr'i:aa aom zhes bya ba'i sa bon gyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa srad bu de rnams la bkod de /
translated: With the seed syllables “hūṃ hriḥ hriḥ aḥ oṃ,” one should place Akṣobhya and so forth on those threads.

original: aom d'i bha drishti aam ku sha dza: zhes mig gnyis su bkod la /🔽rab tu g-yo zhing 'bar ba'i mig / mig gi rdzi ma 'dren pa ni //
analyzed: aom d'i bha drishti aam ku sha dza: zhes mig gnyis su bkod la / rab tu g-yo zhing 'bar ba'i mig / mig gi rdzi ma 'dren pa ni //
translated: Placing “oṃ dīptājñāṃ kuruṣva hūṃ” in the two eyes,🔽one should summon Akṣobhya and so forth with the blazing mudra,🔽saying, “The eyes are very tremulous and blazing,🔽drawing the corners of the eyes.

original: zhes bya ba'i 'bar ba'i lha bas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bskul zhing 'di skad ces @31a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'bar ba'i lha bas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bskul zhing 'di skad ces @31a * //
translated: Having invoked Akṣobhya and so on, the blazing deities say this:🔽🔽

original: brjod de / bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor chen po'i thig gdab par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rdo rje'i thig bdag la stsol cig ces bya bas kyang bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: brjod de / bcom ldan 'das dkyil 'khor chen po'i thig gdab par bya ba'i phyir / rdo rje'i thig bdag la stsol cig ces bya bas kyang bskul bar bya'o //
translated: One should say, “Bhagavat, for the sake of laying out the great maṇḍala,🔽please grant me the vajra thread.”

original: de nas rang gi sa bon gyi 'od kyis bskul ba'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas btang ba'i srad bu 'bar ba'i lcags kyus bkug ste /
analyzed: de nas rang gi sa bon gyi 'od kyis bskul ba'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas btang ba'i srad bu 'bar ba'i lcags kyus bkug ste /
translated: Then, having summoned Akṣobhya and so forth, the tathāgatas who are summoned by the light of one’s seed syllable, one should draw them with the blazing iron hook.

original: rang gi lag na gnas pa'i srad bu de gang bar byas la /
analyzed: rang gi lag na gnas pa'i srad bu de gang bar byas la /
translated: Having filled the thread that is in one's hand,🔽one should recite:

original: aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta sarbba dharmma sphar sphar aa nu pra bishta sarbba dharmma /
analyzed: aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta sarbba dharmma sphar sphar aa nu pra bishta sarbba dharmma /
translated: Anyonya-anugata sarva-dharma sphar sphar anupravistha sarva-dharmas,

original: aa tyan ta aa nu pra bishta sarbba dharmm'a aom h'um hr'i: ho:/
analyzed: aa tyan ta aa nu pra bishta sarbba dharmm'a aom h'um hr'i: ho:/
translated: atyanta-anupravistha sarva-dharmas om hum hri: hoḥ.

original: zhes bya ba zlos shing bsgril bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba zlos shing bsgril bar bya'o //
translated: Reciting this, one should twist [the thread].

original: bsgril nas mig g-yas dang g-yon du ma dang ta las nyi ma dang zla ba bskyed la badzra drishta phat ces bya bas brtan par byas la /
analyzed: bsgril nas mig g-yas dang g-yon du ma dang ta las nyi ma dang zla ba bskyed la badzra drishta phat ces bya bas brtan par byas la /
translated: Having twisted [the thread], one should generate the sun and moon from ma and ta in the right and left eyes, and having stabilized [them] with vajra-dṛṣṭi phaṭ,

original: srad bu de dris byugs la gser la sogs pa'i snod du bzhag nas /
analyzed: srad bu de dris byugs la gser la sogs pa'i snod du bzhag nas /
translated: one should anoint the thread with scent, place it in a vessel of gold, etc.,

original: dri dang me tog dang / bdug sbos kyis mchod la /
analyzed: dri dang me tog dang / bdug sbos kyis mchod la /
translated: and make offerings with scent, flowers, and incense.🔽Having held [the thread] with the vajra-bond, one should recite:

original: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes bya ba rdo rje bsdams pas bzung ste /🔽lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes bya ba rdo rje bsdams pas bzung ste /🔽lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Om vajra-samaya-sūtra mān dakriṃ hūṃ.

original: de nas rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'gro ba 'dul ba dang / sangs rgyas thor tshugs dang / padma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / padma don yod dbang phyug dang sems dpa' bcu drug dang / rdo rje gnod sbyin bzlas pa'i dris dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi yang byugs la me tog gis mdzes par byas nas bar snang na bzhugs pa'i lha thams cad la phyag byas te /
analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad dang / 'gro ba 'dul ba dang / sangs rgyas thor tshugs dang / padma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / padma don yod dbang phyug dang sems dpa' bcu drug dang / rdo rje gnod sbyin bzlas pa'i dris dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi yang byugs la me tog gis mdzes par byas nas bar snang na bzhugs pa'i lha thams cad la phyag byas te /
translated: Then, having anointed the ground of the maṇḍala with the water of the vase of Akṣobhya, Vairocana, Lokeśvara, Buddhaśikhin, Padma, Samādhi, Padma Amoghīśvara, the sixteen sattvas, and Vajrayakṣa, having made it beautiful with flowers, having made obeisance to all the deities abiding in space,

original: aom h'um hr'i: ho: zhes bya bas mchod yon phul la /
analyzed: aom h'um hr'i: ho: zhes bya bas mchod yon phul la /
translated: and having offered water for the feet with “Oṃ hūṃ hrīḥ hoḥ,”

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / sgeg mo la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / sgeg mo la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: having made offerings to all the deities of the maṇḍala with the five offerings and with the offerings of the goddesses such as Lochanā,

original: mig g-yas g-yon du yi ge dza: ser po bkod la /
analyzed: mig g-yas g-yon du yi ge dza: ser po bkod la /
translated: having arranged the yellow syllables jheṃ in the right and left eyes,

original: nyi ma dang zla ba ser po'i snang ba bskyed de /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba ser po'i snang ba bskyed de /
translated: and having generated the appearance of the yellow sun and moon,

original: glu dang rol mo la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: glu dang rol mo la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor brtag par bya'o //
translated: one should examine the maṇḍala with offerings of song, music, and so on.

original: de la re zhig sngar sa mngon par bzlas pa'i kha dog dkar po dri zhim par srad bu mngon par spangs la /
analyzed: de la re zhig sngar sa mngon par bzlas pa'i kha dog dkar po dri zhim par srad bu mngon par spangs la /
translated: First, one should wind the thread, which has been previously enchanted with the mantra and is white and fragrant, around one's finger.

original: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te aom h'um hr'i: ho: zhes bya ba 'dis rang gi snying ga'i padma las grub pa'i grogs po padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi gzugs kyis phyung la /
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba 'dul ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te aom h'um hr'i: ho: zhes bya ba 'dis rang gi snying ga'i padma las grub pa'i grogs po padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi gzugs kyis phyung la /
translated: Then, having formed the great seal of Vinayaka, with the mantra Om hum hriḥ hoḥ, one should draw forth from one's heart lotus friend in the form of Padmanarteshvara.

original: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis srad bu de bzung ste /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis srad bu de bzung ste /
translated: Holding the thread with one's left vajra fist,

original: dza: zhes bya bas bsgrub pa'i grogs pa'i lag tu srad bu de gtad la /
analyzed: dza: zhes bya bas bsgrub pa'i grogs pa'i lag tu srad bu de gtad la /
translated: one should give the thread to the assistant with the mantra Jaḥ.

original: phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgom zhing shar phyogs su bltas te /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgom zhing shar phyogs su bltas te /
translated: Visualizing all directions as equal, facing east,

original: tshangs @31b pa'i thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs @31b pa'i thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: one should lay down the thread of Brahmā.

original: dza: dza: dza: zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i grogs pos yi ge dza: gsum gyis thig skud drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dza: dza: dza: zhes bya ba bsgrub pa'i grogs pos yi ge dza: gsum gyis thig skud drang bar bya'o //
translated: With the mantra Jaḥ jaḥ jaḥ, the assistant should draw the thread straight with the three syllables Jaḥ.

original: yang slob dpon lho ru 'dug la byang du bltas te /
analyzed: yang slob dpon lho ru 'dug la byang du bltas te /
translated: Again, the master, sitting in the south and facing north,

original: tshangs pa'i thig gnyis pa gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i thig gnyis pa gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should lay down the second line of Brahmā.

original: de nas me'i char gnas la byang phyogs su bltas te phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi thig gdab bo //
analyzed: de nas me'i char gnas la byang phyogs su bltas te phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi thig gdab bo //
translated: Then, standing in the southeast, facing north, one should lay down the eastern line of the outer maṇḍala.

original: rlung gi phyogs su gnas la lho phyogs su bltas te nub kyi thig gdab bo //
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs su gnas la lho phyogs su bltas te nub kyi thig gdab bo //
translated: Standing in the northeast, facing south, one should lay down the western line.

original: de nyid du 'dug ste shar du bltas nas byang gi phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
analyzed: de nyid du 'dug ste shar du bltas nas byang gi phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
translated: Sitting in that very place, facing east, one should lay down the northern line.

original: yang me'i mtshams su 'dug ste nub tu bltas la lho phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
analyzed: yang me'i mtshams su 'dug ste nub tu bltas la lho phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
translated: Again, sitting in the southeast, facing west, one should lay down the southern line.

original: de bzhin du lha'i snam bu dang / kha khyer gyi thig kyang gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i snam bu dang / kha khyer gyi thig kyang gdab par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should lay down the lines of the celestial path and the ledges.

original: yang me'i mtshams su gnas te rlung gi phyogs kyi mtshams kyi bar du thig gdab pa dang / yang bden bral gyi mtshams su gnas te /
analyzed: yang me'i mtshams su gnas te rlung gi phyogs kyi mtshams kyi bar du thig gdab pa dang / yang bden bral gyi mtshams su gnas te /
translated: Again, standing in the southeast, one should lay down the lines up to the northeast, and again, standing in the southwest, one should lay down the lines up to the northwest.

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshams kyi bar du thig gdab pa dang / de nas sgo dang / rta babs kyi thig kyang btab la de'i nang du sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed kyi tshad la zur bzhi pa'i ri mo gnyis pa ni sgo la mngon par phyogs par thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams kyi bar du thig gdab pa dang / de nas sgo dang / rta babs kyi thig kyang btab la de'i nang du sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed kyi tshad la zur bzhi pa'i ri mo gnyis pa ni sgo la mngon par phyogs par thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having drawn the lines of the doors and the archways, one should draw two square lines inside that, half the size of the outer maṇḍala, facing the doors, in the manner previously explained.

original: ri mo gnyis pa'i dbus su padma'i phreng ba bris la /
analyzed: ri mo gnyis pa'i dbus su padma'i phreng ba bris la /
translated: In the center of the two lines, one should draw a garland of lotuses.

original: ka ba brgyad dang ldan pa'i cha gsum mnyam par thig btab nas /
analyzed: ka ba brgyad dang ldan pa'i cha gsum mnyam par thig btab nas /
translated: Having drawn three equal parts with eight pillars,

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i thig ni gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i thig ni gdab par bya'o //
translated: one should draw the lines of the eight-petaled lotus.

original: de la re zhig srad bu'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig srad bu'i sngags ni /
translated: Now, the thread mantra is:

original: aom badzra sa ma ya sv'a tram m'a ti kra ma h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya sv'a tram m'a ti kra ma h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra-samaya svātrāṃ mātrikrama hūṃ.

original: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba byas la /
translated: Then, having performed the yoga of Vajrahūṃkāra,

original: mig g-yas pa dang / g-yon par yi ge hr'i: las nyi ma dang zla ba bskyed la /
analyzed: mig g-yas pa dang / g-yon par yi ge hr'i: las nyi ma dang zla ba bskyed la /
translated: one should generate the sun and moon from the syllable hrīḥ in the right and left eyes,

original: khro bo'i lta bas kun nas bltas pas sgo rnams dbye'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i lta bas kun nas bltas pas sgo rnams dbye'o //
translated: and having looked all around with the gaze of wrath, one should open the doors.

original: slob dpon dang bsgrub pa'i grogs mchog bsgyings pa'i tshul gyis bskor phyogs su 'gro bar bya ba ni thig gi cho ga'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dang bsgrub pa'i grogs mchog bsgyings pa'i tshul gyis bskor phyogs su 'gro bar bya ba ni thig gi cho ga'o //
translated: The master and the best of assistants, having arranged the chalk line, should go around the mandala in a clockwise direction. This is the chalk line rite.

original: de nas tshon rtsi byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas tshon rtsi byin gyis brlab par bya ste /
translated: Then one should consecrate the colors.

original: de la tshon dkar po la yi ge aom las rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar po /
analyzed: de la tshon dkar po la yi ge aom las rnam par snang mdzad sku mdog dkar po /
translated: For that, from the syllable OM, Vairochana, white in color, arises in the white color.

original: tshon sngon po la yi ge h'um las mi bskyod pa sku mdog mthing ga / tshon ser po la yi ge tr'am las rin chen 'byung ldan sku mdog ser po /
analyzed: tshon sngon po la yi ge h'um las mi bskyod pa sku mdog mthing ga / tshon ser po la yi ge tr'am las rin chen 'byung ldan sku mdog ser po /
translated: From the syllable HUM, Akshobhya, blue in color, arises in the blue color. From the syllable TRAM, Ratnasambhava, yellow in color, arises in the yellow color.

original: tshon dmar po la yi ge hr'i: las 'od dpag tu med pa sku mdog dmar po /
analyzed: tshon dmar po la yi ge hr'i: las 'od dpag tu med pa sku mdog dmar po /
translated: From the syllable HRĪḤ, Amitābha, red in color, arises in the red color.

original: tshon ljang gu la yi ge aa las don yod grub pa sku mdog ljang gur bskyed la /
analyzed: tshon ljang gu la yi ge aa las don yod grub pa sku mdog ljang gur bskyed la /
translated: From the syllable A, Amoghasiddhi, green in color, arises in the green color.

original: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya ba 'di phyag rgya dang ldan pas re re la yang lan bdun bdun bzla bar bya'o //🔽de la phyag @32a * //
analyzed: aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya ba 'di phyag rgya dang ldan pas re re la yang lan bdun bdun bzla bar bya'o // de la phyag @32a * //
translated: With this mantra and the appropriate mudrā, one should recite each one seven times.

original: rgya ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rgya ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mudrā for that is as follows.

original: rdo rje phyag rgya gnyis las ni //
analyzed: rdo rje phyag rgya gnyis las ni //
translated: From the two vajra-fists,

original: mdzub mo'i rtse mo mnyam sbyar ba //
analyzed: mdzub mo'i rtse mo mnyam sbyar ba //
translated: the tips of the index fingers are joined together.

original: byas nas tshon rtsi thams cad ni //
analyzed: byas nas tshon rtsi thams cad ni //
translated: Having done that, all the colors

original: 'bar ba'i lta bas dgug par bya //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i lta bas dgug par bya //
translated: are summoned with the blazing gaze.

original: yi ge hi zhes bya ba mthar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge hi zhes bya ba mthar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The syllable hi is added at the end.

original: de nas aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya ba'i snying po dang dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas aom badzra tsi tra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya ba'i snying po dang dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, with the essence mantra Oṃ vajra citra samaya hūṃ, starting from the northeast,

original: g-yas nas bskor ba'i rim pas g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis tshon rtsi thog mar bkye la phyi ma ni rdo rje khu tshur med kyang bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas nas bskor ba'i rim pas g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis tshon rtsi thog mar bkye la phyi ma ni rdo rje khu tshur med kyang bya'o //
translated: in the sequence of clockwise rotation, one should first release the colors with the left vajra fist, and later without the vajra fist.

original: rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The sequence is as follows:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / thams cad kyi nang du dkar po bya'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / thams cad kyi nang du dkar po bya'o //
translated: blue, yellow, red, green, and white in the center of all.

original: de nas ji skad du bshad pa'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
analyzed: de nas ji skad du bshad pa'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
translated: Then, having drawn the outer maṇḍala as explained,

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor ni zur bzhi bsnol ba'i ri mo gnyis pa bris la /
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor ni zur bzhi bsnol ba'i ri mo gnyis pa bris la /
translated: the inner maṇḍala is drawn with two intersecting diagonal lines.

original: ri mo gnyis pa'i dbus su padma'i phreng ba bris la /
analyzed: ri mo gnyis pa'i dbus su padma'i phreng ba bris la /
translated: In the center of the second figure, one should draw a garland of lotuses.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lta bu'i ka ba brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lta bu'i ka ba brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw eight pillars in the shape of eight-petaled lotuses.

original: padma de'i ge sar gyi dbus su /
analyzed: padma de'i ge sar gyi dbus su /
translated: In the center of the pericarp of that lotus,

original: seng ge dang padma'i gdan la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa rnam par snang mdzad sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: seng ge dang padma'i gdan la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa rnam par snang mdzad sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw Vairocana seated on a lion and lotus, on a moon disk, in the manner previously explained.

original: de'i phyogs rnams su padma dang zla ba'i gdan la phyag rgya bzhi bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs rnams su padma dang zla ba'i gdan la phyag rgya bzhi bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the directions of that [lotus], one should draw the four mudrās on lotus and moon seats.

original: de ltar 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa yang zla ba dang padma'i gdan la bri ba dang / bskal pa bzang po rnams kyang sngar bshad pa'i rim pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi khyams rnams su /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa yang zla ba dang padma'i gdan la bri ba dang / bskal pa bzang po rnams kyang sngar bshad pa'i rim pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi khyams rnams su /
translated: In the same way, one should draw Lokeśvara and so forth on moon and lotus seats, and the Bhadrakalpa [Buddhas] in the outer courtyard of the maṇḍala, in the manner previously explained.

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i bskal pa bzang po stong du bzhis mtshang ba padma dang / zla ba'i gdan la sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i bskal pa bzang po stong du bzhis mtshang ba padma dang / zla ba'i gdan la sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the thousand Bhadrakalpa [Buddhas], minus four, on lotus and moon seats, seated in the bodhisattva posture.

original: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su mnyam pa'i rim pa bzhin du bya'o ;
analyzed: shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su mnyam pa'i rim pa bzhin du bya'o ;
translated: One should do the same in the eastern direction, and so forth, in the same order.

original: / de nas shar gyi snam bu la /
analyzed: / de nas shar gyi snam bu la /
translated: Then, on the eastern band,

original: sangs rgyas padma bzhin du padma'i rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas padma bzhin du padma'i rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa'o //
translated: Buddha-Padma holds a lotus and a vajra, like Padma-vajra.

original: lho phyogs kyi snam bu la rdo rje rin po che bzhin du rin chen padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi snam bu la rdo rje rin po che bzhin du rin chen padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: On the southern band, Ratna-Padma holds a jewel and a lotus, like Vajra-ratna.

original: yang nub phyogs kyi snam bu la rdo rje chos bzhin du rdo rje padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: yang nub phyogs kyi snam bu la rdo rje chos bzhin du rdo rje padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: On the western band, Dharma-Padma holds a lotus and a vajra, like Vajra-dharma.

original: byang phyogs kyi snam bu la padma gar gyi dbang phyug bzhin du sna tshogs padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi snam bu la padma gar gyi dbang phyug bzhin du sna tshogs padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: On the northern band, Padma-Narteshvara holds a variegated lotus, like Narteshvara.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ni sku mdog dkar po /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ni sku mdog dkar po /
translated: There, the Blessed One Vairochana is white in color,

original: byang chub mchog gi phyag rgyas rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: byang chub mchog gi phyag rgyas rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsnams pa /
translated: holding a five-pointed vajra with the gesture of supreme enlightenment.

original: zhal bzhi pa /
analyzed: zhal bzhi pa /
translated: He has four faces.

original: zhal dang po shar du gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhal dang po shar du gzigs pa'o //
translated: The first face looks to the east.

original: rdo rje sems ma'i gnas su padmas @32b mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa /
analyzed: rdo rje sems ma'i gnas su padmas @32b mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa /
translated: In the place of Vajra-Sattva, there is a five-pointed vajra marked with a lotus.

original: rdo rje rin chen ma'i gnas su yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rtse mo padma can /
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen ma'i gnas su yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rtse mo padma can /
translated: At the site of Vajraratna, a wish-granting gem with a lotus on top.

original: rdo rje chos ma'i gnas su padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i rdo rje padma /
analyzed: rdo rje chos ma'i gnas su padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i rdo rje padma /
translated: At the site of Vajradharma, a sixteen-petaled lotus with a vajra.

original: rdo rje las ma'i gnas su padma 'dab ma bzhi pa /
analyzed: rdo rje las ma'i gnas su padma 'dab ma bzhi pa /
translated: At the site of Vajrakarma, a four-petaled lotus,

original: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'i 'dab ma bzhi pa lte ba dkar po'o //
analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'i 'dab ma bzhi pa lte ba dkar po'o //
translated: with petals of blue, yellow, red, and green, and a white center.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba ni phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dkar dmar /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba ni phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dkar dmar /
translated: The Blessed One, Lokesvara, has two arms and is red in color.

original: phyag g-yon pas padma'i sdong bu bzung nas phyag g-yas pas thugs kar padma 'byed par mdzad pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pas padma'i sdong bu bzung nas phyag g-yas pas thugs kar padma 'byed par mdzad pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Holding the stem of a lotus with his left hand, he opens a lotus at his heart with his right hand.

original: sangs rgyas padma ni sh'akya thub pa'i gzugs can gser gyi mdog mnga' ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas padma ni sh'akya thub pa'i gzugs can gser gyi mdog mnga' ba /
translated: Buddha Padma has the form of Shakyamuni, and is golden in color.

original: g-yon bsnyems pas padma'i dril bu bzung nas /
analyzed: g-yon bsnyems pas padma'i dril bu bzung nas /
translated: Holding a lotus-handled bell with his left hand in a threatening gesture,🔽he opens a lotus with his right hand.

original: phyag g-yas pas kha tv'am ga padmas mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa gung mo'i rtse mo la rang gi snying gar 'degs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas kha tv'am ga padmas mtshan pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa gung mo'i rtse mo la rang gi snying gar 'degs pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa'o //
translated: His right hand holds a five-pronged vajra marked with a khaṭvāṅga and lotus at the tip of the middle finger, as if lifting it to his heart.

original: padma'i rgyal po ni sku mdog ser po phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje /
analyzed: padma'i rgyal po ni sku mdog ser po phyag g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje /
translated: Lotus King is yellow in color. In his first right hand is a vajra;

original: gnyis pa na ral gri /
analyzed: gnyis pa na ral gri /
translated: in the second is a sword.

original: g-yon gyi dang po na lcags kyu /
analyzed: g-yon gyi dang po na lcags kyu /
translated: In his first left hand is a goad;

original: g-yon gyi gnyis pa na padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi gnyis pa na padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: in the second left is a lotus.

original: padma'i chags pa sku mdog dmar po padma'i mda' gzhu 'gengs pas sangs rgyas thams cad gsod pa'i tshul du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i chags pa sku mdog dmar po padma'i mda' gzhu 'gengs pas sangs rgyas thams cad gsod pa'i tshul du mdzad pa'o //
translated: Lotus Passion is red in color and draws a lotus bow and arrow, as if killing all buddhas.

original: padma legs pa ni margad kyi mdog can padma'i se gol brdabs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: padma legs pa ni margad kyi mdog can padma'i se gol brdabs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Good Lotus is the color of an emerald and snaps his fingers, as if pleasing all tathāgatas.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ral pa'i dbus na 'od dpag tu med pa phyag g-yon pas padma bsnams pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ral pa'i dbus na 'od dpag tu med pa phyag g-yon pas padma bsnams pa /
translated: In the middle of Lokeśvara’s hair is Amitābha, holding a lotus in his left hand.

original: phyag g-yas pa ting nge 'dzin mchog gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa ting nge 'dzin mchog gis bzhugs pa /
translated: His right hand is in the gesture of supreme meditation.

original: sku mdog dmar po sangs rgyas thor tshugs zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sku mdog dmar po sangs rgyas thor tshugs zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: His body is red, and he is called the Buddha with the Topknot.

original: padma'i khro gnyer ni sku mdog ser phyag g-yas pa padma'i khu tshur gyis padmas mtshan pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bus dbang bskur ba'i gnas su 'jog pa'i phyag g-yon pa'i bsnyems pas padma'i dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i khro gnyer ni sku mdog ser phyag g-yas pa padma'i khu tshur gyis padmas mtshan pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bus dbang bskur ba'i gnas su 'jog pa'i phyag g-yon pa'i bsnyems pas padma'i dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Lotus Frown is yellow. With his right hand he makes the lotus fist, holding a wish-granting gem marked with a lotus, which he places on the place of consecration. With his left hand he holds a lotus-handled bell with pride.

original: padma'i nyi ma ni sku mdog dmar po nyi ma lta bu phyag g-yon pas padma bsnams shing /
analyzed: padma'i nyi ma ni sku mdog dmar po nyi ma lta bu phyag g-yon pas padma bsnams shing /
translated: Lotus Sun is red, like the sun. He holds a lotus in his left hand.

original: phyag g-yas pas padma la gnas pa'i nyi ma'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas padma la gnas pa'i nyi ma'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'od kyis snang bar mdzad pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: With his right hand he holds a sun marked with a lotus, illuminating all the tathāgatas.

original: padma'i dpal zla ba'i mdog dang de'i cha byad can phyag g-yon pas padmas mtshan pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan bsnams pa /🔽phyag @33a * //
analyzed: padma'i dpal zla ba'i mdog dang de'i cha byad can phyag g-yon pas padmas mtshan pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan bsnams pa / phyag @33a * //
translated: Lotus Glory is the color of the moon and has that form. He holds a wish-granting gem marked with a lotus and a victory banner in his left hand.

original: g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: With his right hand he makes the boon-granting gesture.

original: padma bzhad pa sku mdog dkar ser zhal bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: padma bzhad pa sku mdog dkar ser zhal bcu gcig pa /
translated: Lotus Smile is white-yellow, with eleven faces.

original: phyag bcu gnyis pa tshangs pa'i cha byad can ral pa'i thor tshugs kyis brgyan pa dang / rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bcu gnyis pa tshangs pa'i cha byad can ral pa'i thor tshugs kyis brgyan pa dang / rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: de la zhal dang po zhi ba /
analyzed: de la zhal dang po zhi ba /
translated: His first face is peaceful.

original: de bzhin du zhal g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa'i phyogs kyang zhi ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhal g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa'i phyogs kyang zhi ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, the right and left faces are peaceful.

original: rgyab kyi zhal gcig ni mi sdug pa'i nyams can no //
analyzed: rgyab kyi zhal gcig ni mi sdug pa'i nyams can no //
translated: The one face in the back is of a terrifying aspect.

original: yang zhal dang po'i steng ma gcig ni mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: yang zhal dang po'i steng ma gcig ni mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: Moreover, the one face above the first face bares its fangs.

original: de'i g-yas g-yon gyi zhal gnyis ni mi sdug pa'i nyams can /
analyzed: de'i g-yas g-yon gyi zhal gnyis ni mi sdug pa'i nyams can /
translated: The two faces to the right and left of that are of a terrifying aspect.

original: de'i rgyab ni mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyab ni mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa /
translated: The one behind that bares its fangs.

original: de'i steng ma'i zhal dang po ni mche ba gtsigs pa /🔽zhal g-yas pa ni mche ba phyung ba /
analyzed: de'i steng ma'i zhal dang po ni mche ba gtsigs pa / zhal g-yas pa ni mche ba phyung ba /
translated: The first face above that bares its fangs.🔽The right face bares its fangs.

original: g-yon pa ni drag cing cher bzhad pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa ni drag cing cher bzhad pa /
translated: The left face is fierce and laughs loudly.

original: de'i steng ma gcig ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhal lo //
analyzed: de'i steng ma gcig ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhal lo //
translated: The one above that is the face of a perfect buddha.

original: phyag dang po gnyis ni chos ston pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: phyag dang po gnyis ni chos ston pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The first two hands are in the gesture of teaching the Dharma.

original: gnyis pa gnyis ni me tog gi thal mo mdzad pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa gnyis ni me tog gi thal mo mdzad pa /

analyzed: padmas mtshan pa /

analyzed: mgul pa ras dkar po bzang pos bcings pa /

analyzed: 'dab ma dang / 'bras bu dri zhim pas kha brgyan pa /

analyzed: sbos chu dri zhim pas kun nas byugs te /

analyzed: rdo rje chos mas padma'i me tog gi lcug ma yongs su bzung la /

analyzed: aom badzra au da ka h'um zhes bya bas bzlas brjod brgya rtsa brgyad byas la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba'i sngags kyang brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /

analyzed: bum pa de bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba'i spyan sngar gzhag par bya'o//

original: @35a * // gnyis pa la 'gro ba 'dul ba brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /
analyzed: @35a * // gnyis pa la 'gro ba 'dul ba brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /

original: 'jug pa'i sgor mngon par phyogs par gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgor mngon par phyogs par gzhag par bya zhing /

analyzed: chu des bdag nyid dang slob ma la dbang bskur bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'jug pa'i dus su rdo rje sems ma'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: At the time of entering, one should form the mudrā of Vajrasattva

original: slob ma yang 'ching du gzhug go //
analyzed: slob ma yang 'ching du gzhug go //

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bum pa yang so so rang rang gi mtshan mas mtshan pa /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bum pa yang so so rang rang gi mtshan mas mtshan pa /
translated: The vases of Vairochana and so forth are also marked with their own individual signs.

original: de rnams kyi rang rang gi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas la dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi khyams rnams su gzhag pa dang / de rnams kyi phyi rol du bum pa gang ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang rang gi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas la dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi khyams rnams su gzhag pa dang / de rnams kyi phyi rol du bum pa gang ba'o //
translated: Having completely recited their own individual mantras one hundred and eight times, they are placed in the outer courtyard of the mandala, and outside of them are the vases filled with water.

original: ma rnyed par gyur na bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba la rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / sangs rgyas thor tshugs dang / padma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / don yod dbang phyug rnams la rang rang gi sngags bzlas pa'i bum pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed par gyur na bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba la rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / sangs rgyas thor tshugs dang / padma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / don yod dbang phyug rnams la rang rang gi sngags bzlas pa'i bum pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If they are not available, one should offer the vases of the Blessed One, the Conqueror of the World, and Vairochana, Buddha Keshava, Padma Samadhi, and Amoghasiddhi, each with their own mantra.

original: aom badzra dzhi zhes bya ba'i rigs kyi snying po 'dis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rigs kyi bum pa la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa byas te /
analyzed: aom badzra dzhi zhes bya ba'i rigs kyi snying po 'dis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rigs kyi bum pa la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa byas te /
translated: With this essence mantra of the family, Om Vajra Jhi, one should recite one hundred and eight times the vase of the family of the Conqueror of the World.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i lha rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba'i lha rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer it to the deities of the Conqueror of the World.

original: aom badzra ratna mu ku ta h'um zhes bya bas sangs rgyas thor tshugs kyi rigs kyi bum pa la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra ratna mu ku ta h'um zhes bya bas sangs rgyas thor tshugs kyi rigs kyi bum pa la'o //
translated: With Om vajra ratna mukuta hum, to the vase of the family of Buddha's topknot.

original: aom dharmma padma hr'i: zhes bya bas padma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bum pa la'o //
analyzed: aom dharmma padma hr'i: zhes bya bas padma'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bum pa la'o //
translated: With Om dharmapadma hri, to the vase of the lotus samadhi.

original: aom sarbba mu khi h'um zhes bya bas padma don yod dbang phyug gi bum pa la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa byas nas /
analyzed: aom sarbba mu khi h'um zhes bya bas padma don yod dbang phyug gi bum pa la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa byas nas /
translated: With Om sarva mukha hum, to the vase of Padma Amoghasiddhi, having done the recitation one hundred and eight times.

original: don yod dbang phyug gi rigs kyi lha rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: don yod dbang phyug gi rigs kyi lha rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer to the deities of the family of Amoghasiddhi.

original: de nas bdag po lnga'i bum pa gang ba dang / rigs bzhi'i bum pa gang ba bzhi dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdag po lnga'i bum pa gang ba dang / rigs bzhi'i bum pa gang ba bzhi dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should offer the full vases of the five lords and the four full vases of the four families.

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang gi rig pa yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pa gang bar byas la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang gi rig pa yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pa gang bar byas la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having made full vases with one's own knowledge mantra of the Bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon such as Maitreya, one should offer them.

original: ma rnyed na bum pa rnams dang bum pa gang ba bcu las nyung ba dbul bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rnyed na bum pa rnams dang bum pa gang ba bcu las nyung ba dbul bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one does not have them, one should not offer less than ten full vases and vases of the families.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa ste /
translated: Then is immediately after,

original: ji skad bshad pa de dag byas pa'i rjes thogs la'o //🔽de nas 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i zhes bya ba'i padma'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rgyas pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa de dag byas pa'i rjes thogs la'o // de nas 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i zhes bya ba'i padma'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rgyas pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor nas brtsams te /
translated: after having done what was explained.

original: dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi bar du slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga'i bye brag rgyas par phye'o//🔽@35b de la dang po kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi bar du slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga'i bye brag rgyas par phye'o// @35b de la dang po kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the extensive ritual procedure of the lotus mandala of the tamer of all beings is explained is the extensive division of the ritual procedure of the master's actions, beginning with the yoga of the deity and ending with the vajra observances of spiritual powers.

original: dbab pa la sogs pa'i sngon du song ba'o //
analyzed: dbab pa la sogs pa'i sngon du song ba'o //
translated: There, first of all is prior to the descent and so forth.

original: padma'i slob dpon zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor chen po dang / byin gyis brlabs pa'i slob dbon ni padma'i slob dpon no //
analyzed: padma'i slob dpon zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor chen po dang / byin gyis brlabs pa'i slob dbon ni padma'i slob dpon no //
translated: The lotus master is the master of consecration, the great yoga of the tamer of beings.

original: rdo rje dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni gdong g-yogs bcings la /
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni gdong g-yogs bcings la /
translated: Having bound the pledge seal of the vajra, he should reside as before is having bound the blindfold.

original: phyag bzhi byas te sdom pa bzung la /
analyzed: phyag bzhi byas te sdom pa bzung la /
translated: Having made four prostrations and taken up the vows,

original: phyi rol na gnas pa'i bum pa'i chus bdag nyid la dbang bskur te /
analyzed: phyi rol na gnas pa'i bum pa'i chus bdag nyid la dbang bskur te /
translated: one should confer initiation on oneself with the water of the vase located outside.

original: slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga bzhin du rdo rje chos ma bcings la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga bzhin du rdo rje chos ma bcings la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin no //
translated: One should enter, binding the Vajradharma as in the rite of entering the disciple. This is the meaning of “just as” in the root text.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In the manner of the Great maṇḍala of the Vajra Element”

original: de las bshad pa'i tshul gyis dbab pa la sogs pa'i las rnams bya'o //
analyzed: de las bshad pa'i tshul gyis dbab pa la sogs pa'i las rnams bya'o //
translated: means that one should perform the rites of descent of the awareness beings and so forth in the manner explained in that maṇḍala.

original: snying po 'dis las rnams bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbab pa dang me tog dor ba dang / phreng ba bcing ba'i dbang dang / gdong g-yogs dgrol ba dang / dkyil 'khor blta ba dang / dbab pa nye bar bsdu ba dang / chu'i dbang dang /
analyzed: snying po 'dis las rnams bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbab pa dang me tog dor ba dang / phreng ba bcing ba'i dbang dang / gdong g-yogs dgrol ba dang / dkyil 'khor blta ba dang / dbab pa nye bar bsdu ba dang / chu'i dbang dang /
translated: “One should perform the rites with this essence” means that one should perform the rites of descent of the awareness beings, casting the flower, the initiation of the garland, the removal of the blindfold, the viewing of the maṇḍala, the dissolution of the descent, the water initiation, the crown initiation, the vajra and bell, the name, the master initiation, and the prophecy.

original: phyag rgya'i dbang gis cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba dang / rdo rje padma dang / bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi rjes thogs la /
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dbang gis cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba dang / rdo rje padma dang / bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi rjes thogs la /
translated: After the vajra conduct of spiritual powers,🔽the essence of the lotus family, which will be explained below,

original: padma'i rigs kyi snying po rjes thogs la 'chad par 'gyur bar brjod pa ni /
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi snying po rjes thogs la 'chad par 'gyur bar brjod pa ni /

analyzed: aom padma spho ta aa dhi tishtha aa zhes phyogs gcig dper brjod pa tsam gyis de dag gi snying po rnams kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this mere example of one, the essences of those are also taught.

original: snying po 'di dper brjod pa tsam gyis /
analyzed: snying po 'di dper brjod pa tsam gyis /
translated: By this mere example of the essence,

original: de rnams kyi snying po'ang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying po'ang shes par bya ste /

original: las rnams bya'o zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: las rnams bya'o zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //

original: aom padma spho ta aa dhi tishtha aa zhes bya ba ni dbab pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom padma spho ta aa dhi tishtha aa zhes bya ba ni dbab pa'i don to //
translated: Oṃ padmasphoṭa adhiṣṭhāṇa a is for the purpose of descent.

original: dkyil 'khor 'dir dbab pa'i snying po 'di dang / rdo rje padma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya gnyis su byas nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'dir dbab pa'i snying po 'di dang / rdo rje padma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya gnyis su byas nas /

original: thal mo sbyar nas lan brgya'i bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas lan brgya'i bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having joined the palms, one should repeat it one hundred times.

original: de nas rdo rje dbyings las bshad pa'i g-yon pa'i khro bo'i khu tshur gyi mdzub mos /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dbyings las bshad pa'i g-yon pa'i khro bo'i khu tshur gyi mdzub mos /
translated: Then, with the left fist of wrath as explained in the Vajra Realm,

analyzed: rdo rje padma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i gung mo lan brgya'i bar du dral zhing aa zhes brjod do //
translated: one should tear the middle finger of the pledge seal of the vajra lotus with the index finger one hundred times, saying “aḥ.”🔽Then, having received the command in the same way,

original: de nas de bzhin du bka' ma nos nas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po la bshad pa'i me tog dor ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i cho ga'i go rims thams cad rjes @36a * //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du bka' ma nos nas zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po la bshad pa'i me tog dor ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i cho ga'i go rims thams cad rjes @36a * //
translated: that is, having performed all the procedures of the preliminary rite, such as casting the flower as explained in the great maṇḍala of the Vajra Realm,

original: su spyad pas /
analyzed: su spyad pas /
translated: one should follow

original: ji lta ba bzhin du slob ma 'jug pa'i gnang ba mnos te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du slob ma 'jug pa'i gnang ba mnos te /
translated: the permission to induct the disciples just as it is.

original: de nas yang dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bdag nyid dbang bskur te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa dbang bskur bar bshad pa de bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzungs
analyzed: de nas yang dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bdag nyid dbang bskur te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa dbang bskur bar bshad pa de bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzungs
translated: Then, one should confer empowerment upon oneself with the pledge seal, as explained in the great mandala of the vajra realm, where Vajradhatviśvarī and so on confer empowerment.🔽

original: kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i rdo rje chos kyi phyag rgyas gang la 'od dpag tu med pa'i dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i rdo rje chos kyi phyag rgyas gang la 'od dpag tu med pa'i dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, “one should confer empowerment upon oneself with the pledge seal” means that just as in the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm, the empowerment of Vajradhātvīśvarī and so on is explained, in the same way, in the Avalokiteśvara Tantra, the empowerment of the pledge seal of Vajradharma is conferred.

original: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “The master” is the remainder.

original: padmo'i dbyibs blangs nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: padmo'i dbyibs blangs nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having taken the shape of a lotus” means

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi padmo'i dbang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi padmo'i dbang //
translated: the empowerment of the lotus of all buddhas

original: de ring khyed la bskur bar bya //
analyzed: de ring khyed la bskur bar bya //
translated: is conferred upon you today.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis rab grub phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis rab grub phyir //
translated: In order to accomplish all buddhas,

original: padmo 'di ni khyod kyis long //
analyzed: padmo 'di ni khyod kyis long //
translated: you should accept this lotus.

original: zhes bya ba dang / shing las byas pa'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa sdong bu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / shing las byas pa'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa sdong bu dang bcas pa /

analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su rdo rje rtse lnga pa sor brgyad pa /
translated: In the center of the navel is an eight-finger-width five-pronged vajra,

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i nang du chud pa /
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i nang du chud pa /
translated: contained within an eight-petaled lotus.

original: 'og gi cha'i 'dab ma brgyad kha gyes pa /
analyzed: 'og gi cha'i 'dab ma brgyad kha gyes pa /
translated: The eight petals of the lower part are open.🔽The upper part is slightly closed, in the shape of a lotus, with a lotus bell.

analyzed: steng gi cha'i cung zad kha ma bye bar gyur pa'i padma'i dbyibs dang / padma'i dril bu dang bcas pa blangs te rang gi ming gi dbang bskur ro //

original: rang gi padmo'i ming nas brjod la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi padmo'i ming nas brjod la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Recite one’s lotus name” means

analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas nas lo ke shva ra padma ham zhes pa'am /
translated: having performed the self-consecration and so forth, say “Lokeshvara padma ham,”

analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung ba ji ltar thob pa rang gi padma'i ming grags pas na brjod par bya'o //
translated: or whatever is obtained, as one’s lotus name is renowned, one should recite it.

original: padma'i lcags kyu la sogs pa'i las rnams bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: padma'i lcags kyu la sogs pa'i las rnams bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should perform the activities of the lotus hook and so forth” means

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i cho gas sprul pa dang / bsdu ba byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor las bshad pa'i cho gas sprul pa dang / bsdu ba byas la /
translated: having emanated and reabsorbed through the ritual explained in the Vajradhātu maṇḍala,

original: padmo'i sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: padmo'i sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: the lotus hero, the great hero,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa byas la /
translated: Having praised with the one hundred and eight names,

original: sgo dbye ba'i phyag rgyas sgo phye la /
analyzed: sgo dbye ba'i phyag rgyas sgo phye la /
translated: open the door with the door-opening mudra.

original: rta mgrin la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgyas dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rta mgrin la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgyas dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du byas te /
translated: Summon, induct, bind, and control all the mandala deities with the karma mudras of Hayagriva and so forth.

original: padma'i gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bskrad la /
analyzed: padma'i gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bskrad la /
translated: Drive away obstructors with the lotus yaksha.

original: ra ba dang dra ba byas te /
analyzed: ra ba dang dra ba byas te /
translated: Make the enclosure and net.

original: padma'i khu tshur gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas sgo bcad la /
analyzed: padma'i khu tshur gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas sgo bcad la /
translated: Close the door with the lotus fist pledge mudra.

original: padma'i bsrung ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs te /
analyzed: padma'i bsrung ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bsrung ba thams cad yang dag par bsrungs te /
translated: Guard all guards with the lotus protection pledge mudra.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la phyag byas te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la phyag byas te /
translated: Make obeisance to all the mandala deities.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba la mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil @36b phul la /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba la mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil @36b phul la /
translated: Offer water for the feet and a welcoming drink to the subjugators of migrators.

original: sngags dang phyag rgyas so sor dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyas so sor dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Offer individually with mantra and mudra.

original: de nas chos kyi phyag rgya 'di nyid kyis sems dpa' chen po rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i bar du phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin gyi /
analyzed: de nas chos kyi phyag rgya 'di nyid kyis sems dpa' chen po rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nas padma 'bebs pa'i bar du phyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin gyi /
translated: This refers to the pledge seals of Vairochana and so forth up to Padmanarteshvara, which will be explained later.

original: 'dir de'i chos kyi phyag rgyar mngon par 'dod pa'i yi ge bdag nyid ni 'di ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de'i chos kyi phyag rgyar mngon par 'dod pa'i yi ge bdag nyid ni 'di ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the dharma seal that is the nature of the letters that is asserted here,

original: sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is from the perspective of the practice.

original: gang gi phyir dam tshig gi phyag rgyas dngos su sgrub par bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa de'i phyir /🔽skabs 'dir mngon par 'dod pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam tshig gi phyag rgyas dngos su sgrub par bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa de'i phyir / skabs 'dir mngon par 'dod pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya yang ma yin la /
translated: Because the Bhagavat explained that the pledge seal directly accomplishes,🔽it is not the dharma seal that is asserted here.

original: 'dir dam tshig gi phyag rgya la chos kyi phyag rgyas zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dir dam tshig gi phyag rgya la chos kyi phyag rgyas zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Also, it cannot be said that the pledge seal here is not called the dharma seal.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Also, it is said:

original: rgyud phyi ma las padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi ka la yang chos kyi phyag rgyar brjod la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya rnams ni phyag rgya chen po zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma las padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi ka la yang chos kyi phyag rgyar brjod la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya rnams ni phyag rgya chen po zhes bya zhing /
translated: The Later Tantra says that the four types of seals of the lotus family are all called dharma seals, and the seals of the Tathagata family are called great seals.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi phyag rgya rnams la ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya la /
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi phyag rgya rnams la ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya la /
translated: The seals of the vajra family are called pledge seals.

original: nor bu'i rigs kyi phyag rgya bzhi ka la yang las kyi phyag rgya zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs kyi phyag rgya bzhi ka la yang las kyi phyag rgya zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the four types of seals of the jewel family are called action seals.

original: de nas dngos grub rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the powers are also like that.

original: ji ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang ; sems dpa'i rdo rje la sogs pas //
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang ; sems dpa'i rdo rje la sogs pas //
translated: Just as in the great mandala of the vajra realm, the pledge seals, the sattva vajra and so forth,

original: de ltar sems dpa' chen po bsgrub //
analyzed: de ltar sems dpa' chen po bsgrub //
translated: are the great seals of the Tathagata family.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod cing zhes bya bas lha thams cad kyi rang gi rig pas dngos grub sgrub pa'i rgyur bshad pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos grub kyi don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod cing zhes bya bas lha thams cad kyi rang gi rig pas dngos grub sgrub pa'i rgyur bshad pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos grub kyi don du 'gyur ro //
translated: By saying JAH HUM BAM HOH and so forth, all the deities are explained as the cause of accomplishing feats by one's own knowledge, and in the same way, here also, they are for the sake of feats.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor bris la khrus byas te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor bris la khrus byas te /
translated: Having drawn the mandala in the manner explained, one should bathe.

original: de nas bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Then, one should bless oneself as Vajra Humkara.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du sgo dbye ba byas nas snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po dang ldan pa'i slob dpon gyis gos dkar mo dang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i rgyan rnams la dri zhim pos byug pa
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du sgo dbye ba byas nas snga ma bzhin du 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po dang ldan pa'i slob dpon gyis gos dkar mo dang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rjes su mthun pa'i rgyan rnams la dri zhim pos byug pa
translated: Having opened the door in the proper way, the master who is endowed with the yoga of Subduer of Mara and the great yoga in the same way as before, should anoint with fragrant substances🔽and fumigate with incense the ornaments that are suitable for Subduer of Mara and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: dang / bdug pas bdugs te padma'i gnod sbyin gyi sngags kyis gos thams cad la yongs su bzlas la ze'u ka la sogs pa bcings te /
analyzed: dang / bdug pas bdugs te padma'i gnod sbyin gyi sngags kyis gos thams cad la yongs su bzlas la ze'u ka la sogs pa bcings te /
translated: Having completely enchanted all the garments with the mantra of Lotus Yaksha, one should tie on the bracelets and so forth.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rdo rje rin chen gyis rgyan thams cad la mngon par @37a * //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i rdo rje rin chen gyis rgyan thams cad la mngon par @37a * //
translated: Adorned with all the ornaments explained in the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm,

original: bsngags la bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i ci rigs pa'i rgyan btags te /
analyzed: bsngags la bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i ci rigs pa'i rgyan btags te /
translated: one should put on whatever ornaments are suitable for oneself.

original: yang sngags gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'i padma'i phreng ba'i cod pan la yongs su bzlas te /
analyzed: yang sngags gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa'i padma'i phreng ba'i cod pan la yongs su bzlas te /
translated: Again, one should recite the two mantras over a lotus garland endowed with the tathāgata Amitābha.

original: padma'i cod pan gyi dbang bskur bas bdag nyid la dbang bskur te /
analyzed: padma'i cod pan gyi dbang bskur bas bdag nyid la dbang bskur te /
translated: Having conferred empowerment upon oneself with the empowerment of the lotus crown,

original: mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: one should make perfect offerings with the five offerings.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad blos mngon sum lta bur byas la phyag byas te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad blos mngon sum lta bur byas la phyag byas te /
translated: Having made obeisance to the entire maṇḍala as if it were directly perceived by the mind,

original: mchod yon phul nas me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: mchod yon phul nas me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
translated: having offered a libation, and having made perfect offerings with flowers and so forth,

original: padma dang dril bu bzung nas yang gdong g-yogs dang gos la padma'i gnod sbyin dang / rta mgrin la sogs pa sgo srung rnams kyi sngags yongs su bzlas la /
analyzed: padma dang dril bu bzung nas yang gdong g-yogs dang gos la padma'i gnod sbyin dang / rta mgrin la sogs pa sgo srung rnams kyi sngags yongs su bzlas la /
translated: Holding the lotus and the bell, again one should recite the mantras of the door-guardians such as Padmanartêśvara and Hayagrîva, etc., over the blindfold and the garment.

original: gdong g-yogs bcings nas /
analyzed: gdong g-yogs bcings nas /
translated: Having bound the blindfold,

original: me tog gi phreng ba btags la slob dpon gyis phyag bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba btags la slob dpon gyis phyag bzhi bya'o //
translated: and having put on the garland of flowers, the disciple should make four prostrations to the master.

original: de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas la /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas la /
translated: Then, having performed the confession of sins, etc.,

original: sdom pa gzung bar byas te /🔽byang chub sems ni bla med pa //
analyzed: sdom pa gzung bar byas te / byang chub sems ni bla med pa //
translated: one should take the vow.🔽One should recite:🔽I shall generate the unsurpassed

original: dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi //
analyzed: dam pa bdag gis bskyed par bgyi //
translated: most holy thought of enlightenment.🔽Having begun with that,

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: one should recite:

original: dbugs ma phyung ba dbugs dbyung zhing //
analyzed: dbugs ma phyung ba dbugs dbyung zhing //
translated: I shall liberate those beings who are not liberated,
